[OEBcw - Matt 17:18] Then Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of the boy; and he was cured from that very hour.
[OEBcw - Matt 17:19] Afterwards the disciples came up to Jesus, and asked him privately: “Why was it that we could not drive it out?”
[OEBcw - Matt 17:20] “Because you have so little faith,” he answered; “for, I tell you, if your faith were only like a mustard seed, you could say to this mountain ‘Move from this place to that!’ and it would be moved; and nothing would be impossible to you.”
[OEBcw - Matt 17:21] 
[OEBcw - Matt 17:22] While Jesus and his disciples were together in Galilee, he said to them: “The Son of Man is destined to be betrayed into human hands,
[OEBcw - Matt 17:23] ​and they will put him to death, but on the third day he will rise.” The disciples were greatly distressed.
[OEBcw - Matt 17:24] After they had reached Capernaum, the collectors of the Temple-rate came up to Peter, and said: “Does not your Master pay the Temple-rate?”
[OEBcw - Matt 17:25] “Yes,” answered Peter. But, on going into the house, before he could speak, Jesus said: “What do you think, Simon? From whom do earthly kings take taxes or tribute? From their sons, or from others?”
[OEBcw - Matt 17:26] “From others,” answered Peter. “Well then,” continued Jesus, “their sons go free.
[OEBcw - Matt 17:27] ​Still, so we don't offend them, go and throw a line into the Sea; take the first fish that rises, open its mouth, and you will find in it a piece of money. Take that, and give it to the collectors for both of us.”
[OEBcw - Matt 18 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 18:1] On the same occasion the disciples came to Jesus, and asked him: “Who is really the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
[OEBcw - Matt 18:2] Jesus called a little child to him, and placed it in the middle of them, and then said:
[OEBcw - Matt 18:3] ​“I tell you, unless you change and become like little children, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven at all.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:4] ​Therefore, anyone who will humble themselves like this child — ​that person will be the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:5] ​And anyone who, for the sake of my name, welcomes even one little child like this, is welcoming me.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:6] ​But, if anyone puts temptation in the way of one of these little ones who believe in me, it would be best for them to be sunk in the depths of the sea with a great millstone hung round their neck.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:7] ​Alas for the world because of such temptations! There cannot but be temptations but sorrow awaits the person who does the tempting!
[OEBcw - Matt 18:8] If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off, and throw it away. It would be better for you to enter the life maimed or lame, than to have both hands, or both feet, and be thrown into the fire that never goes out.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:9] ​If your eye causes you to sin, take it out, and throw it away. It would be better for you to enter the life with only one eye, than to have both eyes and be thrown into the fires of Gehenna.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:10] ​Beware of despising one of these little ones, for in heaven, I tell you, their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:11] 
[OEBcw - Matt 18:12] What think you? If a person owns a hundred sheep, and one of them strays, will the person not leave the ninety-nine on the hills, and go and search for the one that is straying?
[OEBcw - Matt 18:13] ​And, if they succeed in finding it, I tell you that they rejoice more over that one sheep than over the ninety-nine which did not stray.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:14] ​So, too, it is the will of my Father who is in heaven that not one of these little ones should be lost.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:15] If your brother or sister does wrong, go to them and convince them of their fault when you are both alone. If they listen to you, you have won them over.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:16] ​But, if they do not listen to you, take with you one or two others, so that ‘on the evidence of two or three witnesses, every word may be put beyond dispute.’
[OEBcw - Matt 18:17] ​If they refuse to listen to them, speak to the church; and, if they also refuse to listen to the church, treat him as you would a Gentile or a tax-gatherer.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:18] I tell you, all that you forbid on earth will be held in heaven to be forbidden, and all that you allow on earth will be held in heaven to be allowed.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:19] ​Again, I tell you that, if but two of you on earth agree as to what they will pray for, whatever it be, it will be granted them by my Father who is in heaven.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:20] ​For where two or three have come together in my name, I am present with them.”
[OEBcw - Matt 18:21] Then Peter came up, and said to Jesus: “Master, how often am I to forgive someone who wrongs me? As many as seven times?”
[OEBcw - Matt 18:22] But Jesus answered: “Not seven times, but ‘seventy times seven.’
[OEBcw - Matt 18:23] ​Therefore the kingdom of heaven may be compared to a king who wished to settle accounts with his servants.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:24] ​When he had begun to do so, one of them was brought to him who owed him ten thousand bags of gold;
[OEBcw - Matt 18:25] ​and, as he could not pay, his master ordered him to be sold towards the payment of the debt, together with his wife, and his children, and everything that he had.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:26] ​The servant threw himself down on the ground before him and said ‘Have patience with me, and I will pay you all.’
[OEBcw - Matt 18:27] ​The master was moved with compassion; and he let him go, and forgave him the debt.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:28] ​But, on going out, that same servant came upon one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred silver coins. Seizing him by the throat, he said ‘Pay what you owe me.’
[OEBcw - Matt 18:29] ​His fellow servant threw himself on the ground and begged for mercy. ‘Have patience with me,’ he said, ‘and I will pay you.’
[OEBcw - Matt 18:30] ​But the other would not, but went and put him in prison until he should pay his debt.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:31] ​When his fellow servants saw what had happened, they were greatly distressed, and went to their master and laid the whole matter before him.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:32] ​So the master sent for the servant, and said to him ‘You wicked servant! When you begged me for mercy, I forgave you the whole of that debt.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:33] ​Ought not you, also, to have shown mercy to your fellow servant, just as I showed mercy to you?’
[OEBcw - Matt 18:34] ​Then his master, in anger, handed him over to the jailers, until he should pay the whole of his debt.
[OEBcw - Matt 18:35] ​So, also, will my heavenly Father do to you, unless each one of you forgives his brother or sister from your heart.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 19:1] At the conclusion of this teaching, Jesus withdrew from Galilee, and went into that district of Judea which is on the other side of the Jordan.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:2] Great crowds followed him, and he cured them there.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:3] Presently some Pharisees came up to him, and, to test him, said: “Has a man the right to divorce his wife for every cause?”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:4] “Have not you read,” replied Jesus, “that at the beginning the Creator ‘made them male and female,’
[OEBcw - Matt 19:5] ​and said — ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother, and be united to his wife, and the man and his wife will become one’?
[OEBcw - Matt 19:6] ​So that they are no longer two, but one. What God himself, then, has yoked together people must not separate.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:7] “Why, then,” they said, “did Moses direct that a man should ‘serve his wife with a notice of separation and divorce her’?”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:8] “Moses, owing to the hardness of your hearts,” answered Jesus, “permitted you to divorce your wives, but that was not so at the beginning.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:9] ​But I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except on the ground of some serious sexual sin, and marries another woman, is guilty of adultery.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:10] “If that,” said the disciples, “is the position of a man with regard to his wife, it is better not to marry.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:11] “It is not everyone,” replied Jesus, “who can accept this teaching, but only those who have been enabled to do so.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:12] ​Some men, it is true, have from birth been disabled for marriage, while others have been disabled by their fellow men, and others again have disabled themselves for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. Let him accept it who can.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:13] Then some little children were brought to Jesus, for him to place his hands on them, and pray; but the disciples found fault with those who had brought them.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:14] Jesus, however, said: “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for it is to the childlike that the kingdom of heaven belongs.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:15] So he placed his hands on them, and then went on his way.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:16] A man came up to Jesus, and said: “Teacher, what good thing must I do to obtain eternal life?”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:17] “Why ask me about goodness?” answered Jesus. “There is but One who is good. If you want to enter the life, keep the commandments.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:18] “What commandments?” asked the man. “These,” answered Jesus: — “‘You must not kill. You must not commit adultery. You must not steal. You must not say what is false about others.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:19] ​Honour your father and your mother.’ And ‘You must love your neighbour as you love yourself.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:20] “I have observed all these,” said the young man. “What is still wanting in me?”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:21] “If you wish to be perfect,” answered Jesus, “go and sell your property, and give to the poor, and you will have wealth in heaven; then come and follow me.”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:22] On hearing these words, the young man went away distressed, for he had great possessions.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:23] At this, Jesus said to his disciples: “I tell you that a rich person will find it hard to enter the kingdom of heaven!
[OEBcw - Matt 19:24] ​I say again, it is easier for a camel to get through a needle’s eye than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of heaven!”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:25] On hearing this, the disciples exclaimed in great astonishment: “Who then can possibly be saved?”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:26] But Jesus looked at them, and said: “With people this is impossible, but with God everything is possible.” Then Peter turned and said to Jesus:
[OEBcw - Matt 19:27] “But we — we left everything, and followed you; what, then, will we have?”
[OEBcw - Matt 19:28] “I tell you,” answered Jesus, “that at the new creation, ‘when the Son of Man takes his seat on his throne of glory,’ you who followed me will be seated on twelve thrones, as judges of the twelve tribes of Israel.
[OEBcw - Matt 19:29] ​Everyone who has left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or children, or land, for my sake, will receive many times as much, and will ‘gain eternal life.’
[OEBcw - Matt 19:30] ​But many who are first now will then be last, and those who are last will be first.
[OEBcw - Matt 20 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 20:1] ​For the kingdom of heaven is like an employer who went out in the early morning to hire labourers for his vineyards.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:2] ​He agreed with the labourers to pay them the standard daily rate of two silver coins, and sent them into his vineyard.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:3] ​On going out again, about nine o’clock, he saw some others standing in the marketplace, doing nothing.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:4] ​‘You also may go into my vineyard,’ he said, ‘and I will pay you what is fair.’
[OEBcw - Matt 20:5] ​So they went. Going out again about midday and about three o’clock, he did as before.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:6] ​When he went out about five, he found some others standing there, and said to them ‘Why have you been standing here all day long, doing nothing?’
[OEBcw - Matt 20:7] ​‘Because no one has hired us,’ they answered. ‘You also may go into my vineyard,’ he said.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:8] ​In the evening the owner of the vineyard said to his steward ‘Call the labourers, and pay them their wages, beginning with the last, and ending with the first.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:9] ​Now when those who had been hired about five o’clock went up, they received two silver coins each.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:10] ​So, when the first went up, they thought that they would receive more, but they also received two silver coins each;
[OEBcw - Matt 20:11] ​on which they began to grumble at their employer.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:12] ​‘These last,’ they said, ‘have done only one hour’s work, and yet you have put them on the same footing with us, who have borne the brunt of the day’s work, and the heat.’
[OEBcw - Matt 20:13] ​‘My friend,’ was his reply to one of them, ‘I am not treating you unfairly. Did not you agree with me for two silver coins?
[OEBcw - Matt 20:14] ​Take what belongs to you, and go. I choose to give to this last man the same as to you.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:15] ​Have not I the right to do as I choose with what is mine? Are you envious because I am liberal?’
[OEBcw - Matt 20:16] ​So those who are last will be first, and the first last.”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:17] When Jesus was on the point of going up to Jerusalem, he gathered the twelve disciples round him by themselves, and said to them as they were on their way:
[OEBcw - Matt 20:18] ​“Listen! We are going up to Jerusalem; and there the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and teachers of the law, and they will condemn him to death,
[OEBcw - Matt 20:19] ​and give him up to the Gentiles for them to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify; and on the third day he will rise.”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:20] Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to him with her sons, bowing to the ground, and begging a favour.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:21] ​“What is it that you want?” he asked. “I want you to say,” she replied, “that in your kingdom these two sons of mine may sit, one on your right, and the other on your left.”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:22] “You do not know what you are asking,” was Jesus’ answer. “Can you drink the cup that I am to drink?” “Yes,” they exclaimed, “we can.”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:23] “You will indeed drink my cup,” he said, “but as to a seat at my right and at my left — that is not mine to give, but it is for those for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:24] On hearing of this, the ten others were very indignant about the two brothers.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:25] Jesus, however, called the ten to him, and said: “The rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them as you know, and their high officials oppress them.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:26] ​Among you it is not so.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:27] ​No, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant, and whoever wants to take the first place among you, must be your slave;
[OEBcw - Matt 20:28] ​just as the Son of Man came, not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:29] As they were going out of Jericho, a great crowd followed him.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:30] Two blind men who were sitting by the roadside, hearing that Jesus was passing, called out: “Take pity on us, Master, Son of David!”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:31] The crowd told them to be quiet; but the men only called out the louder: “Take pity on us, Master, Son of David!”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:32] Then Jesus stopped and called them. “What do you want me to do for you?” he said.
[OEBcw - Matt 20:33] “Master,” they replied, “we want our eyes to be opened.”
[OEBcw - Matt 20:34] So Jesus, moved with compassion, touched their eyes, and immediately they recovered their sight, and followed him.
[OEBcw - Matt 21 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 21:1] When they had almost reached Jerusalem, having come as far as Bethphage, on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent on two disciples.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:2] ​“Go to the village facing you,” he said, “and you will immediately find an ass tethered, with a foal by her side; untie her, and lead her here for me.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:3] ​And, if anyone says anything to you, you are to say this — ​‘The Master wants them’; and he will send them at once.”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:4] This happened in fulfilment of these words in the prophet —
[OEBcw - Matt 21:5] ‘Say to the people of Zion — “Your King is coming to you, gentle, and riding on an ass, and on the foal of a beast of burden.”’
[OEBcw - Matt 21:6] So the disciples went and did as Jesus had directed them.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:7] They led the ass and the foal back, and, when they had put their cloaks on them, he seated himself on them.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:8] The immense crowd of people spread their cloaks in the road, while some cut branches off the trees, and spread them on the road.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:9] The crowds that led the way, as well as those that followed behind, kept shouting: “God save the Son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! God save him from on high!”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:10] When he had entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred, and asked —
[OEBcw - Matt 21:11] “Who is this?”, to which the crowd replied — “This is the prophet Jesus from Nazareth in Galilee.”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:12] Jesus went into the Temple Courts, and drove out all those who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers, and the seats of the pigeon-dealers,
[OEBcw - Matt 21:13] and said to them: “Scripture says ‘My house will be called a house of prayer’; but you are making it ‘a den of robbers.’”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:14] While he was still in the Temple Courts, some blind and some lame people came up to him, and he cured them.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:15] But, when the chief priests and the teachers of the law saw the wonderful things that Jesus did, and the boys who were calling out in the Temple Courts “God save the Son of David!”, they were indignant,
[OEBcw - Matt 21:16] and said to him: “Do you hear what these boys are saying?”  “Yes,” answered Jesus; “but did you never read the words — ‘Out of the mouths of babes and sucklings you have called forth perfect praise’?”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:17] Then he left them, and went out of the city to Bethany, and spent the night there.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:18] The next morning, in returning to the city, Jesus became hungry;
[OEBcw - Matt 21:19] and, noticing a solitary fig tree by the roadside, he went up to it, but found nothing on it but leaves. So he said to it: “Never again will fruit be gathered off you.” And suddenly the fruit tree withered up.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:20] When the disciples saw this, they exclaimed in astonishment: “How suddenly the fig tree withered up!”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:21] “I tell you,” replied Jesus, “if you have faith, without ever a doubt, you will do what not only what has been done to the fig tree, but, even if you should say to this hill ‘Be lifted up and hurled into the sea!’ it would be done.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:22] ​And whatever you ask for in your prayers will, if you have faith, be granted you.”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:23] After Jesus had come into the Temple Courts, the chief priests and the councillors of the Nation came up to him as he was teaching, and said: “What authority have you to do these things? Who gave you this authority?”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:24] “I, too,” said Jesus in reply, “will ask you one question; if you will give me an answer to it, then I, also, will tell you what authority I have to act as I do.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:25] ​It is about John’s baptism. What was its origin? Divine or human?” But they began arguing among themselves: “If we say ‘divine,’ he will say to us ‘Why then did not you believe him?’
[OEBcw - Matt 21:26] But if we say ‘human,’ we are afraid of the people, for everyone regards John as a prophet.”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:27] So the answer they gave Jesus was — “We do not know.”  “Then I,” he said, “refuse to tell you what authority I have to do these things.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:28] ​What do you think of this? There was a man who had two sons. He went to the elder and said ‘Go and work in the vineyard today my son.’
[OEBcw - Matt 21:29] ​‘Yes, sir,’ he answered; but he did not go.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:30] ​Then the father went to the second son, and said the same. ‘I will not,’ he answered; but afterwards he was sorry and went.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:31] ​Which of the two sons did as his father wished?” “The second,” they said. “I tell you,” added Jesus, “that tax-gatherers and prostitutes are going into the kingdom of God before you.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:32] ​For when John came to you, walking in the path of righteousness, you did not believe him, but tax-gatherers and prostitutes did; and yet you, though you saw this, even then were not sorry, nor did you believe him.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:33] Listen to another parable. A man, who was an employer, once planted a vineyard, put a fence round it, dug a winepress in it, built a tower, and then let it out to tenants and went abroad.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:34] ​When the time for the grape harvest drew near, he sent his servants to the tenants, to receive his share of the produce.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:35] ​But the tenants seized his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:36] ​A second time the owner sent some servants, a larger number than before, and the tenants treated them in the same way.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:37] ​As a last resource he sent his son to them. ‘They will respect my son,’ he said.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:38] ​But the tenants, on seeing his son, said to each other ‘Here is the heir! Come, let us kill him, and get his inheritance.’
[OEBcw - Matt 21:39] ​So they seized him, and threw him outside the vineyard, and killed him.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:40] ​Now, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:41] “Miserable wretches!” they exclaimed, “he will put them to a miserable death, and he will let out the vineyard to other tenants, who will pay him his share of the produce at the proper times.”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:42] Then Jesus added: “Have you never read in the scriptures? — ​‘The ​stone which the builders despised — Has now itself become the corner-stone; This corner-stone has come from the Lord, and is marvellous in our eyes.’
[OEBcw - Matt 21:43] ​That, I tell you, is why the kingdom of God will be taken from you, and given to a nation that does produce the fruit of the kingdom.
[OEBcw - Matt 21:44] ​Yes, and he who falls on this stone will be dashed to pieces, while anyone on whom it falls — it will scatter him as dust.”
[OEBcw - Matt 21:45] After listening to these parables, the chief priests and the Pharisees saw that it was about them that he was speaking;
[OEBcw - Matt 21:46] yet, although eager to arrest him, they were afraid of the crowds, who regarded him as a prophet.
[OEBcw - Matt 22 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 22:1] Once more Jesus spoke to them in parables.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:2] ​“The kingdom of heaven,” he said, “may be compared to a king who gave a banquet in honour of his son’s wedding.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:3] ​He sent his servants to call those who had been invited to the banquet, but they were unwilling to come.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:4] ​A second time he sent some servants, with orders to say to those who had been invited ‘I have prepared my breakfast, my cattle and fat beasts are killed and everything is ready; come to the banquet.’
[OEBcw - Matt 22:5] ​They, however, took no notice, but went off, one to their farm, another to their business;
[OEBcw - Matt 22:6] ​while the rest, seizing his servants, ill-treated them and killed them.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:7] ​The king, in anger, sent his troops, put those murderers to death, and set their city on fire.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:8] ​Then he said to his servants ‘The banquet is prepared, but those who were invited were not worthy.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:9] ​So go to the cross-roads, and invite everyone you find to the banquet.’
[OEBcw - Matt 22:10] ​The servants went out into the roads and collected all the people whom they found, whether bad or good; and the bridal-hall was filled with guests.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:11] ​But, when the king went in to see his guests, he noticed there a man who had not put on a wedding-robe.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:12] ​So he said to him ‘My friend, how is it that you came in here without a wedding-robe?’ The man was speechless.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:13] ​Then the king said to the attendants ‘Tie him hand and foot, and ‘put him out into the darkness’ outside, where there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.’
[OEBcw - Matt 22:14] ​For many are called, but few chosen.”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:15] Then the Pharisees went away and conferred together as to how they might lay a trap for Jesus in the course of conversation.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:16] They sent their disciples, with the Herodians, to say to him: “Teacher, we know that you are an honest person, and that you teach the way of God honestly, and are not afraid of anyone; for you pay no regard to a person’s position.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:17] Tell us, then, what you think. Are we right in paying taxes to the Emperor, or not?”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:18] Perceiving their malice, Jesus answered: “Why are you testing me, you hypocrites?
[OEBcw - Matt 22:19] ​Show me the coin with which the tax is paid.” And, when they had brought him a coin,
[OEBcw - Matt 22:20] he asked: “Whose head and title are these?”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:21] “The Emperor’s,” they answered: on which he said to them: “Then pay to the Emperor what belongs to the Emperor, and to God what belongs to God.”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:22] They wondered at his answer, and left him alone and went away.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:23] That same day some Sadducees came up to Jesus, maintaining that there is no resurrection. Their question was this: —
[OEBcw - Matt 22:24] “Teacher, Moses said — ‘should a man die without children, the man’s brother will become the husband of the widow, and raise a family for his brother.’
[OEBcw - Matt 22:25] Now we had living among us seven brothers; of whom the eldest married and died, and, as he had no family, left his wife for his brother.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:26] The same thing happened to the second and the third brothers, and indeed to all the seven.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:27] The woman herself died last of all.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:28] At the resurrection, then, whose wife will she be out of the seven, all of them having been married to her?”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:29] “Your mistake,” replied Jesus, “is due to your ignorance of the scriptures, and of the power of God.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:30] ​For at the resurrection there is no marrying or being married, but all who rise are as angels in heaven.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:31] ​As to the resurrection of the dead, have you not read these words of God —
[OEBcw - Matt 22:32] ​‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of dead people, but of living.”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:33] The crowds, who had been listening to him, were greatly struck with his teaching.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:34] When the Pharisees heard that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, they collected together.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:35] Then one of them, a Student of the law, to test him, asked this question —
[OEBcw - Matt 22:36] “Teacher, what is the great commandment in the law?”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:37] His answer was: “‘You must love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
[OEBcw - Matt 22:38] ​This is the great first commandment.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:39] ​The second, which is like it, is this — ‘You must love your neighbour as you love yourself.’
[OEBcw - Matt 22:40] ​On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:41] Before the Pharisees separated, Jesus put this question to them —
[OEBcw - Matt 22:42] ​“What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” “David’s,” they said.
[OEBcw - Matt 22:43] ​“How is it, then,” Jesus replied, “that David, speaking under inspiration, calls him ‘lord,’ in the passage —
[OEBcw - Matt 22:44] ​‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand, until I put your enemies beneath your feet”’?
[OEBcw - Matt 22:45] ​Since, then, David calls him ‘lord,’ how is he David’s son?”
[OEBcw - Matt 22:46] No one could say a word in answer; nor did anyone after that day venture to question him further.
[OEBcw - Matt 23 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 23:1] Then Jesus speaking to the crowds and to his disciples, said:
[OEBcw - Matt 23:2] ​“The teachers of the law and the Pharisees now occupy the chair of Moses.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:3] ​Therefore practice and lay to heart everything that they tell preach but do not practice.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:4] ​While they make up heavy loads and pile them on other people’s shoulder’s they decline, themselves, to lift a finger to move them.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:5] ​All their actions are done to attract attention. They widen their phylacteries, and increase the size of their tassels,
[OEBcw - Matt 23:6] ​and like to have the place of honour at dinner, and the best seats in the Synagogues,
[OEBcw - Matt 23:7] ​and to be greeted in the markets with respect, and to be called ‘Rabbi’ for everybody.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:8] ​But do not allow yourselves to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have only one teacher, and you yourselves are all brothers and sisters.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:9] ​And do not call anyone on the earth your ‘Father,’ for your have only one Father, the heavenly Father.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:10] ​Nor must you allow yourselves to be called ‘leaders,’ for you have only one leader, the Christ.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:11] ​The person who wants to be the greatest among you must be your servant.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:12] ​Whoever exalts themselves will be humbled, and whoever humbles themselves will be exalted.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:13] ​But alas for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, hypocrites that you are! You turn the key of the kingdom of heaven in people’s faces. For you do not go in yourselves, nor yet allow those who try to go in to do so.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:14] ​Alas for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, hypocrites that you are! You destroy widow’s houses, even while pretending to make long prayers; therefore you will receive greater condemnation.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:15] ​Alas for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, hypocrites that you are! You scour land and sea to make a single convert, and, when they are gained, you make them twice as deserving of Gehenna as you are yourselves.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:16] ​Alas for you, you blind guides! You say ‘if any answer by the Temple, their oath counts for nothing; but, if anyone swears by the gold of the Temple, their oath is binding them’!
[OEBcw - Matt 23:17] ​Fools that you are and blind! Which is the more important? The gold? Or the Temple which has given sacredness to the gold?
[OEBcw - Matt 23:18] ​You say, too, ‘If anyone swears by the altar, their oath counts for nothing, but, if anyone swears by the offering placed on it, their oath is binding on them’!
[OEBcw - Matt 23:19] ​Blind indeed! Which is the more important? The offering? Or the altar which gives sacredness to the offering?
[OEBcw - Matt 23:20] ​Therefore a person, swearing by the altar, swears by it and by all that is on it,
[OEBcw - Matt 23:21] ​and a person, swearing by the Temple, swears by it and by him who dwells in it,
[OEBcw - Matt 23:22] ​while a person, swearing by heaven, swears by the throne of God, and by him who sits on it.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:23] ​Alas for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, hypocrites that you are! You pay tithes on mint, fennel, and caraway seed, and have neglected the weightier matters of the law — justice, mercy, and good faith. These last you ought to have put into practice, without neglecting the first.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:24] ​You blind guides, to strain out a gnat and to swallow a camel!
[OEBcw - Matt 23:25] ​Alas for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, hypocrites that you are! You clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside they are filled with the results of greed and self-indulgence.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:26] ​You blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and the dish, so that the outside may become clean as well.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:27] ​Alas for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, hypocrites that you are! You are like whitewashed tombs, which indeed look fair outside, while inside they are filled with dead people’s bones and all kinds of filth.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:28] ​It is the same with you. Outwardly, and to others, you have the look of religious people, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and sin.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:29] ​Alas for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, hypocrites that you are! You build the tombs of the prophets, and decorate the monuments of religious people,
[OEBcw - Matt 23:30] ​and say ‘Had we been living in the days of our ancestors, we should have taken part in their murder of the prophets!
[OEBcw - Matt 23:31] ​By doing this you are furnishing evidence against yourselves that you are true children of the people who murdered the prophets.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:32] ​Fill up the measure of your ancestor’s guilt.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:33] ​You snakes and children of snakes! How can you escape being sentenced to Gehenna?
[OEBcw - Matt 23:34] ​That is why I send you prophets, wise people, and teachers of the law, some of whom you will crucify and kill, and some of whom you will scourge in your Synagogues, and persecute from town to town;
[OEBcw - Matt 23:35] ​in order the blood on your heads may fall every drop of innocent ‘blood split on earth,’ from the blood of innocent Abel down to that of Zechariah, Barachiah’s son, whom you murdered between the Temple and the altar.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:36] ​All this, I tell you, will come home to the present generation.
[OEBcw - Matt 23:37] ​Jerusalem! Jerusalem! She who slays the prophets and stones the messengers sent to her — Oh, how often have I wished to gather your children round me, as a hen gathers her brood under her wings, and you would not come!
[OEBcw - Matt 23:38] ​Verily, your house is left to you desolate!
[OEBcw - Matt 23:39] ​For nevermore, I tell you, will you see me, until you say — ​‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
[OEBcw - Matt 24 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 24:1] Leaving the Temple Courts, Jesus was walking away, when his disciples came up to draw his attention to the Temple buildings.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:2] ​“Do you see all these things?” was his answer. “I tell you, not a single stone will be left here on another, which will not be thrown down,”
[OEBcw - Matt 24:3] so, while Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, his disciples came up to him privately and said: “Tell us when this will be, and what will be the sign of your coming, and of the close of the age.”
[OEBcw - Matt 24:4] Jesus replied to them: “See that no one leads you astray;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:5] ​for, many will take my name, and come saying ‘I am the Christ,’ and will lead many astray.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:6] ​You will hear of wars and rumours of wars; take care not to be alarmed, for such things must occur; but the end is not yet here.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:7] ​For ‘nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom,’ and there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:8] ​All this, however, will be but the beginning of the birth pangs!
[OEBcw - Matt 24:9] ​When that time comes, they will give you up to persecution, and will put you to death, and you will be hated by all nations because of me.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:10] ​And then many will fall away, and will betray one another, and hate one another.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:11] ​Many false prophets, also, will appear and lead many astray;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:12] ​and, owing to the increase of wickedness, the love of most will grow cold.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:13] ​Yet the person who endures to the end will be saved.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:14] ​This good news of the kingdom will be proclaimed throughout the world as a witness to all nations; and then will come the end.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:15] ​As soon, then, as you see ‘the Foul Desecration,’ mentioned by the prophet Daniel, standing in the Holy place,” (the reader must consider what this means)
[OEBcw - Matt 24:16] ​“then those of you who are in Judea must take refuge in the mountains;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:17] ​and a man on the housetop must not go down to get the things that are in his house;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:18] ​nor must one who is on their farm turn back to get his cloak.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:19] ​Alas for pregnant women, and for those who are nursing infants in those days!
[OEBcw - Matt 24:20] ​Pray, too, that your flight may not take place in winter, nor on a Sabbath;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:21] ​for that will be ‘a time of great distress, the like of which has not occurred from the beginning of the world down to the present time’ — no, nor ever will again.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:22] ​Had not those days been limited, not a single soul would escape; but for the sake of ‘God’s people’ a limit will be put to them.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:23] ​At that time, if anyone should say to you ‘Look! Here is the Christ!’ or ‘Here he is!’, do not believe it;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:24] ​for false Christs and false prophets will arise, and will display great signs and marvels, so that, were it possible, even God’s people would be led astray.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:25] ​Remember, I have told you beforehand.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:26] ​Therefore, if people say to you ‘He is in the wilderness!’, do not go out there; or ‘He is in an inner room!’, do not believe it;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:27] ​for, just as lightning will start from the east and flash across to the west, so will it be with the coming of the Son of Man.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:28] ​Wherever a dead body lies, there will the vultures flock.’
[OEBcw - Matt 24:29] ​Immediately after the distress of those days, ‘the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give her light, the stars will fall from the heavens,’ and ‘the forces of the heavens will be convulsed.’
[OEBcw - Matt 24:30] ​Then will appear the sign of the Son of Man in the heavens; and all the peoples of the earth will mourn, when they see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the heavens,’ with power and great glory;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:31] ​and he will send his angels, with a great trumpet, and they will gather his people round him from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:32] Learn the lesson taught by the fig tree. As soon as its branches are full of sap, and it is bursting into leaf, you know that summer is near.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:33] ​And so may you, as soon as you see all these things, know that he is at your doors.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:34] ​I tell you, even the present generation will not pass away, until all these things have taken place.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:35] ​The heavens and the earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:36] ​But about that day and hour, no one knows — not even the angels of heaven, nor yet the Son — but only the Father himself.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:37] ​For, just as in the days of Noah, so will it be at the coming of the Son of Man.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:38] ​In those days before the flood they went on eating and drinking, marrying and being married, up to the very day on which Noah entered the ark,
[OEBcw - Matt 24:39] ​taking not notice until the flood came and swept them one and all away; and so will it be at the coming of the Son of Man.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:40] ​At that time, of two men on a farm one will be taken and one left;
[OEBcw - Matt 24:41] ​of two women grinding with the hand-mill one will be taken and one left.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:42] ​Therefore watch; for you cannot be sure on what day your Master is coming.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:43] ​But this you do know, that, had the owner of the house known at what time of night the thief was coming, they would have been on the watch, and would not have allowed their house to be broken into.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:44] ​Therefore, you must also prepare, since it is just when you are least expecting him that the Son of Man will come.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:45] ​Who, then is that trustworthy, careful servant, who has been placed by their master over his household, to give them their food at the proper time?
[OEBcw - Matt 24:46] ​Happy will that servant be whom their master, when he comes home, will find doing this.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:47] ​I tell you that their master will put them in charge of the whole of his property.
[OEBcw - Matt 24:48] ​But, should the servant be a bad servant, and say to themselves ‘My master is a long time in coming,’
[OEBcw - Matt 24:49] ​and begin to beat their fellow servants, and eat and drink with drunkards,
[OEBcw - Matt 24:50] ​that servant’s master will come on a day when they do not expect him, and at an hour of which they are unaware,
[OEBcw - Matt 24:51] ​and will flog the servant severely, and assign them their place among the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.
[OEBcw - Matt 25 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 25:1] ​Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten bridesmaids who took their lamps and went out to meet the groom.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:2] ​Five of them were foolish, and five were prudent.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:3] ​The foolish ones took their lamps, but took no oil with them;
[OEBcw - Matt 25:4] ​while the prudent ones, besides taking their lamps, took oil in their jars.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:5] ​As the groom was late in coming, they all became drowsy, and slept.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:6] ​But at midnight a shout was raised — ‘The groom is coming! Come out to meet him!’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:7] ​Then all the bridesmaids woke up and trimmed their lamps,
[OEBcw - Matt 25:8] ​and the foolish said to the prudent ‘Give us some of your oil; our lamps are going out.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:9] ​But the prudent ones answered ‘No, There may not be enough for you and for us. Go instead to those who sell it, and buy for yourselves.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:10] ​But while they were on their way to buy it, the groom came; and the bridesmaids who were ready went in with him to the banquet, and the door was shut.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:11] ​Afterwards the other bridesmaids came. ‘Sir, Sir,’ they said, ‘open the door to us!’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:12] ​But the groom answered ‘I tell you, I do not know you.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:13] ​Therefore watch, since you know neither the day nor the hour.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:14] For it is as though a man, going on his travels, called his servants, and gave his property into their charge.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:15] ​He gave five bags of gold to one, two to another, and one bag to a third, in proportion to the ability of each. Then he set out on his travels.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:16] ​The servant who had received the five bags of gold went at once and traded with it, and made another five bags.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:17] ​So, too, the servant who had received the two bags of gold made another two bags.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:18] ​But the servant who had received the one bag went and dug a hole in the ground, and hid his master’s money.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:19] ​After a long time the master of those servants returned, and settled accounts with them.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:20] ​The servant who had received the five bags of gold came up and brought five bags more. ‘Sir,’ he said, ‘you entrusted me with five bags of gold; look, I have made another five bags!’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:21] ​‘Well done, good, trustworthy servant!’ said his master. ‘You have been trustworthy with a small sum; now I will place a large one in your hands; come and share your master’s joy!’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:22] ​Then the one who had received the two bags of gold came up and said ‘Sir, you entrusted me with two bags pounds; look, I have made another two!’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:23] ​‘Well done, good, trustworthy servant!’ said his master. ‘You have been trustworthy with a small sum; now I will place a large one in your hands; come and share your master’s joy!’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:24] ​The man who had received the single bag of gold came up, too, and said ‘Sir, I knew that you were a hard man; you reap where you have not sown, and gather up where you have not winnowed;
[OEBcw - Matt 25:25] ​and, in my fear, I went and hid your money in the ground; look, here is what belongs to you!’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:26] ​‘You lazy, worthless servant!’ was his master’s reply. ‘You knew that I reap where I have not sown, and gather up where I have not winnowed?
[OEBcw - Matt 25:27] ​Then you ought to have placed my money in the hands of bankers, and I, on my return, should have received my money, with interest.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:28] ​‘Therefore,’ he continued, ‘take away from him the one bag of gold, and give it to the one who has the ten bags.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:29] ​For, to him who has, more will be given, and he will have abundance; but, as for him who has nothing, even what he has will be taken away from him.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:30] ​As for the useless servant, ‘put him out into the darkness’ outside, where there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:31] When the Son of Man has come in his glory and all the angels with him, then he ‘will take his seat on his throne of glory’;
[OEBcw - Matt 25:32] ​and all the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate the people — just as a shepherd separates sheep from goats —
[OEBcw - Matt 25:33] ​placing the sheep on his right hand, and the goats on his left.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:34] ​Then the king will say to those on his right ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father, enter into possession of the kingdom prepared for you ever since the beginning of the world.
[OEBcw - Matt 25:35] ​For, when I was hungry, you gave me food; when I was thirsty, you gave me drink; when I was a stranger, you took me to your homes;
[OEBcw - Matt 25:36] ​when I was naked, you clothed me; when I fell ill, you visited me; and when I was in prison, you came to me.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:37] ​Then the righteous will answer ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, and feed you? Or thirsty, and give you a drink?
[OEBcw - Matt 25:38] ​When did we see you a stranger, and take you to our homes? Or naked, and clothe you?
[OEBcw - Matt 25:39] ​When did we see you ill, or in prison, and come to you?’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:40] ​And the king will reply ‘I tell you, as often as you did it to one of these my brothers or sisters, however unimportant they seemed, you did it to me.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:41] ​Then he will say to those on his left ‘Go from my presence, accursed, into the ‘permanent fire which has been prepared for the devil and his angels.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:42] ​For, when I was hungry, you gave me no food; when I was thirsty, you gave me no drink;
[OEBcw - Matt 25:43] ​when I was a stranger, you did not take me to your homes; when I was naked, you did not clothe me; and, when I was ill and in prison, you did not visit me.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:44] ​Then they, in their turn, will answer ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or ill, or in prison, and did not supply your wants?’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:45] ​And then he will reply ‘I tell you, as often as you failed to do it to one of these, however unimportant, you failed to do it to me.’
[OEBcw - Matt 25:46] ​And these last will go away ‘into lasting correction,’ but the righteous ‘into lasting life.’”
[OEBcw - Matt 26 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 26:1] When Jesus had finished teaching all of that, he said to his disciples:
[OEBcw - Matt 26:2] ​“You know that in two days time the Festival of the Passover will be here; and that the Son of Man is to be given up to be crucified.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:3] Then the chief priests and the councillors of the Nation met in the house of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,
[OEBcw - Matt 26:4] and plotted together to arrest Jesus by stealth and put him to death;
[OEBcw - Matt 26:5] but they said: “Not during the Festival, or the people may riot.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:6] After Jesus had reached Bethany, and while he was in the house of Simon the leper,
[OEBcw - Matt 26:7] a woman came up to him with an alabaster jar of very costly perfume, and poured the perfume on his head as he sat at the table.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:8] The disciples were indignant at seeing this. “What is this waste for?” they exclaimed.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:9] “It could have been sold for a large sum, and the money given to poor people.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:10] “Why are you troubling the woman?” Jesus said, when he noticed it. “For this is a beautiful deed that she has done to me.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:11] ​You always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:12] ​In pouring this perfume on my body, she has done it for my burying.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:13] ​I tell you, wherever, in the whole world, this good news is proclaimed, what this woman has done will be told in memory of her.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:14] It was then that one of the Twelve, named Judas Iscariot, made his way to the chief priests,
[OEBcw - Matt 26:15] and said “What are you willing to give me, if I betray Jesus to you?” The Priests ‘weighed him out thirty pieces of silver’ as payment.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:16] So from that time Judas looked for an opportunity to betray Jesus.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:17] On the first day of the Festival of the unleavened bread, the disciples came up to Jesus, and said: “Where do you wish us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:18] “Go into the city to a certain man,” he answered, “and say to him ‘The teacher says — My time is near. I will keep the Passover with my disciples at your house.’”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:19] The disciples did as Jesus directed them, and prepared the Passover.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:20] In the evening Jesus took his place with the twelve disciples,
[OEBcw - Matt 26:21] and, while they were eating, he said: “I tell you that one of you will betray me.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:22] In great grief they began to say to him, one by one: “Can it be I, Master?”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:23] “The one who dipped his bread beside me in the dish,” replied Jesus, “is the one who will betray me.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:24] ​True, the Son of Man must go, as scripture says of him, yet alas for that man by whom the Son of Man is being betrayed! For that man ‘it would be better never to have been born!’”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:25] Judas, who was betraying him, turned to him and said: “Can it be I, Rabbi?”  “It is,” answered Jesus.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:26] While they were eating, Jesus took some bread, and, after saying the blessing, broke it and, as he gave it to his disciples, said: “Take it and eat it; this is my body.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:27] Then he took a cup, and, after saying the thanksgiving, gave it to them, with the words: “Drink from it, all of you;
[OEBcw - Matt 26:28] ​for this is my covenant blood, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:29] ​I tell you that I will never, after this, drink of this juice of the grape, until that day when I will drink it new with you in the kingdom of my Father.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:30] They then sang a hymn, and went out to the Mount of Olives.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:31] Then Jesus said to them: “Even you will all fall away from me tonight. Scripture says — ‘I will strike down the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
[OEBcw - Matt 26:32] ​But, after I have risen, I will go before you into Galilee.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:33] “If everyone else falls away from you,” Peter answered, “I will never fall away!”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:34] “I tell you,” replied Jesus, “that this very night, before the cock crows, you will disown me three times!”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:35] “Even if I must die with you,” Peter exclaimed, “I will never disown you!” All the disciples spoke in the same way.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:36] Then Jesus came with them to a garden called Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples: “Sit down here while I go and pray over there.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:37] Taking with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to show signs of sadness and deep distress of mind.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:38] ​“I am sad at heart,” he said, “sad even to death; wait here and watch with me.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:39] Going on a little further, he threw himself on his face in prayer. “My Father,” he said, “if it is possible, let me be spared this cup; only, not as I will, but as you will.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:40] Then he came to his disciples, and found them asleep. “What!” he said to Peter, “could none of you watch with me for one hour?
[OEBcw - Matt 26:41] ​Watch and pray so that you don't fall into temptation. True, the spirit is eager, but human nature is weak.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:42] Again, a second time, he went away, and prayed. “My Father,” he said, “if I cannot be spared this cup, but must drink it, your will be done!”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:43] And coming back again he found them asleep, for their eyes were heavy.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:44] So he left them, and went away again, and prayed a third time, again saying the same words.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:45] Then he came to the disciples, and said: “Sleep on now, and rest yourselves. Look - my time is close at hand, and the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of wicked people.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:46] ​Up, and let us be going. Look! My betrayer is close at hand.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:47] And, while he was still speaking, Judas, who was one of the Twelve, came in sight; and with him was a great crowd of people, with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and councillors of the nation.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:48] Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them. “The man whom I kiss,” he had said, “will be the one; arrest him.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:49] So he went up to Jesus at once, and exclaimed: “Welcome, Rabbi!” and kissed him;
[OEBcw - Matt 26:50] on which Jesus said to him: “Friend, do what you have come for.” The men went up, seized Jesus, and arrested him.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:51] Suddenly one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and striking the high priest’s servant, cut off his ear.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:52] ​“Sheathe your sword,” Jesus said, “for all who draw the sword will be put to the sword.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:53] ​Do you think that I cannot ask my Father for help, when he would at once send to my aid more than twelve legions of angels?
[OEBcw - Matt 26:54] ​But in that case how would the scriptures be fulfilled, which say that this must be?”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:55] Jesus at the same time said to the crowds: “Have you come out, as if after a robber, with swords and clubs, to take me? I have sat teaching day after day in the Temple Courts, and yet you did not arrest me.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:56] The whole of this occurred in fulfilment of the Prophetic scriptures. Then the disciples all forsook him and fled.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:57] Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the teachers of the law and the councillors had assembled.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:58] Peter followed him at a distance as far as the courtyard of the offices, to see the end.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:59] Meanwhile the chief priests and the whole of the High Council were trying to get such false evidence against Jesus, as would warrant putting him to death,
[OEBcw - Matt 26:60] but they did not find any, although many came forward with false evidence. Later on, however, two men came forward and said:
[OEBcw - Matt 26:61] “This man said ‘I am able to destroy the Temple of God, and to build it in three days.’”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:62] Then the high priest stood up, and said to Jesus: “Have you no answer? What is this evidence which these men are giving against you?”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:63] But Jesus remained silent. The high priest said to him: “I order you, by the living God, to tell us whether you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:64] “It is true,” Jesus answered; “Moreover I tell you all that hereafter you will ‘see the Son of Man sitting on the right hand of the Almighty, and coming on the clouds of the heavens.’”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:65] Then the high priest tore his robes. “This is blasphemy!” he exclaimed. “Why do we want any more witnesses? You have just heard his blasphemy!
[OEBcw - Matt 26:66] What is your decision?” They answered: “He deserves death.”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:67] Then they spat in his face, and struck him, while others dealt blows at him, saying as they did so:
[OEBcw - Matt 26:68] “Now play the prophet for us, you Christ! Who was it that struck you?”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:69] Peter, meanwhile, was sitting outside in the courtyard; and a maidservant came up to him, and exclaimed: “Why, you were with Jesus the Galilean!”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:70] But Peter denied it before them all. “I do not know what you mean,” he replied.
[OEBcw - Matt 26:71] When he had gone out into the gateway, another maid saw him, and said to those who were there: “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth!”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:72] Again he denied it with an oath: “I do not know the man!”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:73] But soon afterwards those who were standing by came up and said to Peter: “You also are certainly one of them; why, even your way of speaking proves it!”
[OEBcw - Matt 26:74] Then Peter said: “I swear that I do not know the man! May God punish me if I am lying!” At that moment a cock crowed;
[OEBcw - Matt 26:75] and Peter remembered the words which Jesus had said — ‘Before a cock has crowed, you will disown me three times’; and he went outside, and wept bitterly.
[OEBcw - Matt 27 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 27:1] At daybreak all the chief priests and the councillors of the nation consulted together against Jesus, to bring about his death.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:2] They put him in chains and led him away, and gave him up to the Roman Governor, Pilate.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:3] Then Judas, who betrayed him, seeing that Jesus was condemned, repented of what he had done, and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and councillors.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:4] “I did wrong in betraying a good man to his death,” he said. “What has that to do with us?” they replied. “You must see to that yourself.”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:5] Judas flung down the pieces of silver in the Temple, and left; and went away and hanged himself.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:6] The chief priests took the pieces of silver, but they said: “We must not put them into the Temple treasury, because they are blood-money.”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:7] So, after consultation, they bought with them the ‘Potter’s Field’ for a burial-ground for foreigners;
[OEBcw - Matt 27:8] and that is why that field is called the ‘Field of Blood’ to this very day.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:9] Then it was that these words spoken by the prophet Jeremiah were fulfilled — ​‘They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him who was valued, whom some of the people of Israel valued,
[OEBcw - Matt 27:10] and gave them for the Potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.’
[OEBcw - Matt 27:11] Meanwhile Jesus was brought before the Roman Governor. “Are you the king of the Jews?” asked the Governor. “It is true,” answered Jesus.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:12] While charges were being brought against him by the chief priests and councillors, Jesus made no reply.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:13] Then Pilate said to him: “Do not you hear how many accusations they are making against you?”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:14] Yet Jesus made no reply — not even a single word; at which the Governor was greatly astonished.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:15] Now, at the feast, the Governor was accustomed to grant the people the release of any one prisoner whom they might choose.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:16] At that time they had a notorious prisoner called Barabbas.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:17] So, when the people had collected, Pilate said to them: “Which do you wish me to release for you? Barabbas? Or Jesus who is called ‘Christ’?”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:18] For he knew that it was out of jealousy that they had given Jesus up to him.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:19] While he was still on the Bench, his wife sent this message to him — “Do not have anything to do with that good man, for I have been very unhappy today in a dream because of him.”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:20] But the chief priests and the councillors persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas, and to kill Jesus.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:21] The Governor, however, said to them: “Which of these two do you wish me to release for you?” “Barabbas,” they answered.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:22] “What then,” Pilate asked, “should I do with Jesus who is called ‘Christ?’ “Let him be crucified,” they all replied.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:23] “Why, what harm has he done?” he asked. But they kept shouting furiously: “Let him be crucified!”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:24] When Pilate saw that his efforts were unavailing, but that, on the contrary, a riot was beginning, he took some water, and washed his hands in the sight of the crowd, saying as he did so: “I am not answerable for this bloodshed; you must see to it yourselves.”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:25] And all the people answered: “His blood be on our heads and on our children’s!”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:26] The Pilate released Barabbas to them; but Jesus he scourged, and gave him up to be crucified.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:27] After that, the Governor’s soldiers took Jesus with them into the Government house, and gathered the whole garrison round him.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:28] They stripped him, and put on him a red military cloak,
[OEBcw - Matt 27:29] and having twisted some thorns into a crown, put it on his head, and a rod in his right hand, and then, going down on their knees before him, they mocked him. “Long life to you, king of the Jews!” they said.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:30] They spat at him and, taking the rod, kept striking him on the head;
[OEBcw - Matt 27:31] and, when they had left off mocking him, they took off the military cloak, and put his own clothes on him, and led him away to be crucified.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:32] As they were on their way out, they came upon a man from Cyrene of the name of Simon; and they compelled him to go with them to carry the cross.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:33] On reaching a place named Golgotha (a place named from its likeness to a skull),
[OEBcw - Matt 27:34] they gave him some wine to drink which had been mixed with gall; but after tasting it, Jesus refused to drink it.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:35] When they had crucified him, they divided his clothes among them by casting lots.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:36] Then they sat down, and kept watch over him there.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:37] Above his head they fixed the accusation against him written out — ‘THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.’
[OEBcw - Matt 27:38] At the same time two robbers were crucified with him, one on the right, the other on the left.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:39] The passers-by railed at him, shaking their heads as they said:
[OEBcw - Matt 27:40] “You who ‘destroy the Temple and build one in three days,’ save yourself! If you are God’s Son, come down from the cross!”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:41] In the same way the chief priests, with the Teaches of the law and councillors, said in mockery:
[OEBcw - Matt 27:42] “He saved others, but he cannot save himself! He is the ‘king of Israel’! Let him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in him.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:43] He has trusted in God; if God wants him, let him deliver him now; for he said ‘I am God’s Son.’”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:44] Even the robbers, who were crucified with him, insulted him in the same way.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:45] After midday a darkness came over all the country, lasting until three in the afternoon.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:46] About three Jesus called out loudly: “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabacthani” — that is to say, ‘My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?’
[OEBcw - Matt 27:47] Some of those standing by heard this, and said: “The man is calling for Elijah!”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:48] One of them immediately ran and took a sponge, and, filling it with common wine, put it on the end of a rod, and offered it to him to drink.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:49] But the rest said: “Wait and let us see if Elijah is coming to save him.”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:50] But Jesus, uttering another loud cry, gave up his spirit.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:51] Suddenly the Temple curtain was torn in two from top to bottom, the earth shook, the rocks were torn asunder,
[OEBcw - Matt 27:52] the tombs opened, and the bodies of many of God’s people who had fallen asleep rose,
[OEBcw - Matt 27:53] and they, leaving their tombs, went, after the resurrection of Jesus, into the Holy City, and appeared to many people.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:54] The Roman captain, and the men with him who were watching Jesus, on seeing the earthquake and all that was happening, became greatly frightened and exclaimed: “This must indeed have been God’s Son!”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:55] There were many women there, watching from a distance, who had accompanied Jesus from Galilee and had been attending on him.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:56] Among them were Mary of Magdala, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:57] When evening had fallen, there came a rich man belonging to Ramah, named Joseph, who had himself become a disciple of Jesus.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:58] He went to see Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus. Pilate ordered it to be given him.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:59] So Joseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen sheet,
[OEBcw - Matt 27:60] and laid it in his newly made tomb which he had cut in the rock; and, before he left, he rolled a great stone against the entrance of the tomb.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:61] Mary of Magdala and the other Mary remained behind, sitting in front of the grave.
[OEBcw - Matt 27:62] The next day — that is, the day following the Preparation-day — the chief priests and Pharisees came in a body to Pilate, and said:
[OEBcw - Matt 27:63] “Sir, we remember that, during his lifetime, that impostor said ‘I will rise after three days.’
[OEBcw - Matt 27:64] So order the tomb to be made secure until the third day. Otherwise his disciples may come and steal him, and then say to the people ‘He has risen from the dead,’ when the latest imposture will be worse than the first.”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:65] “You may have a guard,” was Pilate’s reply; “go and make the tomb as secure as you can.”
[OEBcw - Matt 27:66] So they went made the tomb secure, by sealing the stone, in presence of the guard.
[OEBcw - Matt 28 - start] 
[OEBcw - Matt 28:1] After the Sabbath, as the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary of Magdala and the other Mary had gone to look at the grave,
[OEBcw - Matt 28:2] when suddenly a great earthquake occurred. For an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled away the stone, and seated himself on it.
[OEBcw - Matt 28:3] His appearance was as dazzling as lightning, and his clothing was as white as snow;
[OEBcw - Matt 28:4] and, in their terror of him, the men on guard trembled violently and became like dead men.
[OEBcw - Matt 28:5] But the angel, addressing the women, said; “You need not be afraid. I now that it is Jesus, who was crucified, for whom you are looking.
[OEBcw - Matt 28:6] He is not here; for he has risen, as he said he would. Come, and see the place where he was lying;
[OEBcw - Matt 28:7] and then go quickly and say to him disciples ‘He has risen from the dead, and is going before you into Galilee; there you will see him.’ Remember, I have told you.”
[OEBcw - Matt 28:8] They left the tomb quickly, in awe and great joy, and ran to tell the news to the disciples.
[OEBcw - Matt 28:9] Suddenly Jesus met them. “Welcome!” he said. The women went up to him, and clasped his feet, bowing to the ground before him. Then Jesus said to them:
[OEBcw - Matt 28:10] ​“Do not be afraid; go and tell my brothers and sisters to set out for Galilee, and they will see me there.”
[OEBcw - Matt 28:11] While they were still on their way, some of the guard came into the city, and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.
[OEBcw - Matt 28:12] So they and the councillors met and, after holding a consultation, gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,
[OEBcw - Matt 28:13] and told them to say that his disciples came in the night, and stole him while they were asleep;
[OEBcw - Matt 28:14] “And should this matter come before the Governor,” they added, “we will satisfy him, and see that you have nothing to fear.”
[OEBcw - Matt 28:15] So the soldiers took the money, and did as they were instructed. This story spread widely; the people of Judea still tell it today.
[OEBcw - Matt 28:16] The eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus told them to meet him;
[OEBcw - Matt 28:17] and, when they saw him, they bowed to the ground before him; although some felt doubtful.
[OEBcw - Matt 28:18] Then Jesus came up, and spoke to them , saying:  “All authority in heaven and on the earth has been given to me.
[OEBcw - Matt 28:19] ​Therefore go and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them into the faith of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit,
[OEBcw - Matt 28:20] ​and teaching them to lay to heart all the commands that I have given you; and, remember, I myself am with you every day until the close of the age.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - Mark 1:1] The beginning of the good news about Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:2] It is said in the prophet Isaiah — ‘I am sending my messenger ahead of you; he will prepare your way.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:3] The voice of one crying aloud in the wilderness: “Make ready the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.”’
[OEBcw - Mark 1:4] And in fulfilment of this, John the Baptizer appeared in the wilderness, proclaiming a baptism on repentance, for the forgiveness of sins.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:5] The whole of Judea, as well as all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, went out to him; and they were baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:6] John wore clothes made of camels’ hair, with a leather strap round his waist, and lived on locusts and wild honey;
[OEBcw - Mark 1:7] and he proclaimed — “There is coming after me one more powerful than I, and I am not fit even to stoop down and unfasten his sandals.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:8] I have baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:9] Now about that time Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:10] Just as he was coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens split open, and the Spirit, like a dove, descending on him,
[OEBcw - Mark 1:11] and from the heavens came a voice — “You are my dearly loved son; you bring me great joy.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:12] Immediately afterwards the Spirit drove Jesus out into the wilderness;
[OEBcw - Mark 1:13] and he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted by Satan, and among the wild beasts, while the angels helped him.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:14] After John had been committed to prison, Jesus went to Galilee, proclaiming the good news of God —
[OEBcw - Mark 1:15] ​“The time has come, and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent, and believe the good news.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:16] As Jesus was going along the shore of the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net in the Sea, for they were fishermen.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:17] ​“Come and follow me,” Jesus said, “and I will teach you to fish for people.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:18] They left their nets at once, and followed him.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:19] Going on a little further, he saw James, Zebedee’s son, and his brother John, who also were in their boat mending the nets.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:20] Jesus called them at once, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the crew, and went after him.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:21] They walked into Capernaum. On the next Sabbath Jesus went into the Synagogue and began to teach.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:22] The people were amazed at his teaching, for he taught them like one who had authority, and not like the teachers of the law.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:23] Now there was in their Synagogue at the time a man under the power of a foul spirit, who called out:
[OEBcw - Mark 1:24] “What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are — the Holy One of God!”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:25] But Jesus rebuked the spirit: “Be silent! Come out from him.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:26] The foul spirit threw the man into a fit, and with a loud cry came out from him.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:27] They were all so amazed that they kept asking: “What is this? Strange teaching indeed! He gives his commands with authority even to the foul spirits, and they obey him!”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:28] And the fame of Jesus spread at once in all directions, through the whole neighbourhood of Galilee.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:29] As soon as they had come out from the Synagogue, they went, with James and John, into the house of Simon and Andrew.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:30] Now Simon’s mother-in-law was lying ill with fever, and they at once told Jesus about her.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:31] Jesus went up to her and, grasping her hand, raised her up; the fever left her, and she began to take care of them.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:32] In the evening, after sunset, the people brought to Jesus all who were ill or possessed by demons;
[OEBcw - Mark 1:33] and the whole city was gathered round the door.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:34] Jesus cured many who were ill with various diseases, and drove out many demons, and would not permit them to speak, because they knew him to be the Christ.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:35] In the morning, long before daylight, Jesus rose and went out, and, going to a lonely spot, there began to pray.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:36] But Simon and his companions went out searching for him;
[OEBcw - Mark 1:37] and, when they found him, they exclaimed: “Everyone is looking for you!”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:38] But Jesus said to them: “Let us go somewhere else, into the country towns nearby so that I can make my proclamation in them also; for that was why I came.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:39] And he went about making his proclamation in their Synagogues all through Galilee, and driving out the demons.
[OEBcw - Mark 1:40] One day a leper came to Jesus and, falling on his knees, begged him for help. “If only you are willing,” he said, “you are able to make me clean.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:41] Moved with compassion, Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying as he did so: “I am willing; become clean.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:42] Instantly the leprosy left the man, and he became clean;
[OEBcw - Mark 1:43] and then Jesus, after sternly warning him, immediately sent him away, and said to him:
[OEBcw - Mark 1:44] ​“Be careful not to say anything to anyone; but go and show yourself to the priest, and make the offerings for your cleansing directed by Moses, as evidence of your cure.”
[OEBcw - Mark 1:45] The man, however, went away, and began to speak about it publicly, and to spread the story so widely, that Jesus could no longer go openly into a town, but stayed outside in lonely places; and people came to him from every direction.
[OEBcw - Mark 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - Mark 2:1] Some days later, when Jesus came back to Capernaum, the news spread that he was in a house there;
[OEBcw - Mark 2:2] and so many people collected together, that after a while there was no room for them even round the door; and he began to tell them his message.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:3] Some people came, bringing to him a paralysed man, who was being carried by four of them.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:4] Being, however, unable to get him near to Jesus, owing to the crowd, they removed the roofing above Jesus; and, when they had made an opening, they let down the mat on which the paralysed man was lying.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:5] When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the man: “Child, your sins are forgiven.”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:6] But some of the teachers of the law who were sitting there were debating in their minds:
[OEBcw - Mark 2:7] “Why does this man speak like this? He is blaspheming! Who can forgive sins except God?”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:8] Jesus, at once intuitively aware that they were debating with themselves in this way, said to them: “Why are you debating in your minds about this?
[OEBcw - Mark 2:9] ​Which is easier? — to say to the paralysed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven’? Or to say ‘Get up, and take up your mat, and walk’?
[OEBcw - Mark 2:10] ​But so you may know that the Son of Man has power to forgive sins on earth” — here he said to the paralysed man —
[OEBcw - Mark 2:11] ​“To you I say, Get up, take up your mat, and return to your home.”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:12] The man got up, and immediately took up his mat, and went out before them all; at which they were amazed, and, as they praised God, they said: “We have never seen anything like this!”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:13] Jesus went out again to the Sea; and all the people came to him, and he taught them.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:14] As he went along, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting in the tax office, and said to him: “Follow me.” Levi got up and followed him.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:15] Later on he was in his house having dinner, and a number of tax-gatherers and outcasts took their places at the table with Jesus and his disciples; for many of them were following him.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:16] When the teachers of the law belonging to the party of the Pharisees saw that he was eating in the company of such people, they said to his disciples: “He is eating in the company of tax-gatherers and outcasts!”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:17] Hearing this, Jesus said: “It is not those who are healthy who need a doctor, but those who are ill. I did not come to call the religious, but the outcast.”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:18] Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and people came and asked Jesus: “Why is it that John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, while yours do not?”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:19] Jesus answered: “Can the groom’s friends fast, while the groom is with them? As long as they have the groom with them, they cannot fast.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:20] ​But the days will come, when the groom will be taken away from them, and they will fast then — when that day comes.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:21] “No one ever sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; if they do, the patch tears away from it — the new from the old — and a worse tear is made.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:22] ​And no one ever puts new wine into old wine-skins; if they do, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the skins are lost. But new wine is put into fresh skins.”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:23] One Sabbath, as Jesus was walking through the cornfields, his disciples began to pick the ears of wheat as they went along.
[OEBcw - Mark 2:24] “Look!” the Pharisees said to him, “why are they doing what is not allowed on the Sabbath?”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:25] “Have you never read,” answered Jesus, “what David did when he was in need and hungry, he and his companions —
[OEBcw - Mark 2:26] ​How he went into the house of God, in the time of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the consecrated bread, which only the priests are allowed to eat, and gave some to his comrades as well?”
[OEBcw - Mark 2:27] Then Jesus added: “The Sabbath was made for people, and not people for the Sabbath;
[OEBcw - Mark 2:28] ​so the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”
[OEBcw - Mark 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - Mark 3:1] On another occasion Jesus went in to a Synagogue, where there was a man whose hand was withered.
[OEBcw - Mark 3:2] And they watched Jesus closely, to see if he would cure the man on the Sabbath, so that they might have a charge to bring against him.
[OEBcw - Mark 3:3] ​“Stand out in the middle,” Jesus said to the man with the withered hand;
