[OEBcw - Gal 6:10] Therefore, I say, as the opportunity occurs, let us treat everyone with kindness, and especially members of the Household of the faith.
[OEBcw - Gal 6:11] See in what large letters I am writing with my own hand.
[OEBcw - Gal 6:12] Those who wish to appear to advantage in regard to outward observances are the ​people who are trying to compel you to be circumcised; and they do it only to avoid being persecuted for the cross of Jesus, the Christ.
[OEBcw - Gal 6:13] Even these men who are circumcised do not themselves keep the law; yet they want you to be circumcised, so that they may boast of your observance of the rite.
[OEBcw - Gal 6:14] But, for my part, may I never boast of anything except the cross of Jesus Christ, our Master, through whom the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.
[OEBcw - Gal 6:15] For neither is circumcision nor the omission of it anything; but a new nature is everything.
[OEBcw - Gal 6:16] May all who rule their conduct by this principle find peace and mercy — they who are the Israel of God.
[OEBcw - Gal 6:17] For the future let no one trouble me; for I bear the marks of Jesus branded on my body.
[OEBcw - Gal 6:18] May the blessing of Jesus Christ, our Lord, rest on your souls, friends. Amen.
[OEBcw - Eph 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - Eph 1:1] To Christ’s people at Ephesus who are faithful to him, from Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus, by the will of God.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:2] May God, our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ bless you and give you peace.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:3] Blessed is the God and Father of Jesus Christ, our Lord, who has blessed us on high with every spiritual blessing, in Christ.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:4] For he chose us in our union with Christ before the creation of the universe, so that we might be holy and blameless in his sight, living in the spirit of love.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:5] From the first he destined us, in his goodwill towards us, to be adopted as sons through Jesus Christ,
[OEBcw - Eph 1:6] and so to enhance that glorious manifestation of his loving kindness which he gave us in the one he loves;
[OEBcw - Eph 1:7] for in him, and through the shedding of his blood, we have found redemption in the pardon of our offences.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:8] All this accords with the loving kindness which God lavished on us, accompanied by countless gifts of wisdom and discernment,
[OEBcw - Eph 1:9] when he made known to us his hidden purpose. And it also accords with the goodwill which God purposed to exhibit in Christ,
[OEBcw - Eph 1:10] in view of that divine order which was to mark the completion of the ages, when he should make everything, both in heaven and on earth, centre in him.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:11] In him, I say, for by our union with him we became God’s heritage, having from the first been destined for this in the intention of him who, in all that happens, is carrying out his own fixed purpose;
[OEBcw - Eph 1:12] that we should enhance his glory — we who have been the first to rest our hopes on the Christ.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:13] And you, too, by your union with him, after you had heard the message of the truth, the good news of your salvation — you believed in him and were sealed as his by receiving the holy Spirit, which he had promised.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:14] And the Spirit is a pledge of our future heritage, foreshadowing the full redemption of God’s own people — to enhance his glory.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:15] And therefore I, ever since I heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which prevails among you, and of your confidence in all Christ’s people,
[OEBcw - Eph 1:16] have never omitted to thank God on your behalf, whenever I make mention of you in my prayers.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:17] My prayer is that the God of Jesus Christ our Lord, the all-glorious Father, may inspire you with wisdom and true insight through a fuller knowledge of himself;
[OEBcw - Eph 1:18] that your minds may be so enlightened that you may realise the hope given by God’s call, the wealth of the glory of his heritage among Christ’s people,
[OEBcw - Eph 1:19] and the transcendent greatness of the power which he is able to exercise in dealing with us who believe in him.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:20] The same mighty power was exerted on the Christ, when he raised the Christ from the dead and ‘caused him to sit at his right hand’ on high, exalting him above all angels and archangels of every rank,
[OEBcw - Eph 1:21] and above every name that can be named, whether in the present age, or in the age to come.
[OEBcw - Eph 1:22] And God placed ‘all things under Christ’s feet,’ and gave him to the church as its supreme head;
[OEBcw - Eph 1:23] for the church is Christ’s body, and is filled by him who fills all things everywhere with his presence.
[OEBcw - Eph 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - Eph 2:1] You yourselves were once dead because of your offences and sins.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:2] For at one time you lived in sin, following the ways of the world, in subjection to the Ruler of the powers of the air — the Spirit who is still at work among the disobedient.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:3] And it was among them that we all once lived our lives, indulging the cravings of our earthly nature, and carrying out the desires prompted by that earthly nature and by our own thoughts. Our ​nature exposed us to the divine wrath, like the rest of humanity.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:4] Yet God, in his abundant compassion, and because of the great love with which he loved us,
[OEBcw - Eph 2:5] even though we were ‘dead’ because of our offences, gave life to us in giving life to the Christ. (By God’s loving kindness you have been saved.)
[OEBcw - Eph 2:6] And, through our union with Christ Jesus, God raised us with him, and caused us to sit with him on high,
[OEBcw - Eph 2:7] in order that, by his goodness to us in Christ Jesus, he might display in the ages to come the boundless wealth of his loving kindness.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:8] For it is by God’s loving kindness that you have been saved, through your faith. It is not due to yourselves; the gift is God’s.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:9] It is not due to obedience to law, so that no one can boast.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:10] For we are God’s handiwork, created, by our union with Christ Jesus, for the good actions in doing which God had pre-arranged that we should spend our lives.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:11] Remember, therefore, that you were once Gentiles yourselves, as your bodies showed; you were called ‘The Uncircumcised’ by those who were called ‘The Circumcised’ — circumcised only by human hands!
[OEBcw - Eph 2:12] Remember that you were at that time far from Christ; you were shut out from the citizenship of Israel; you were strangers to the Covenants founded on God’s Promise; you were in the world without hope and without God.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:13] But now, through your union with Christ Jesus, you who once were ‘far off’ have, by the shedding of the blood of the Christ, been brought ‘near.’
[OEBcw - Eph 2:14] He it is who is our peace. He made the two divisions of humanity one, broke down the barrier that separated them,
[OEBcw - Eph 2:15] and in his human nature put an end to the cause of enmity between them — the law with its injunctions and ordinances — in order to create, through union with himself, from Jew and Gentile, one new humanity and so make peace.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:16] And when, on the cross, he had destroyed their mutual enmity, he sought by means of his cross to reconcile them both to God, united in one body.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:17] He came with the good news of peace for you who were ‘far off,’ and of peace for those who were ‘near’;
[OEBcw - Eph 2:18] for it is through him that we, the Jews and the Gentiles, united in the one Spirit, are now able to approach the Father.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:19] It follows, then, that you are no longer strangers and aliens, but are fellow citizens with Christ’s people and members of God’s Household.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:20] You have been built up on the foundation laid by the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being ‘the corner-stone.’
[OEBcw - Eph 2:21] United in him, every part of the building, closely joined together, will grow into a Temple, consecrated by its union with the Lord.
[OEBcw - Eph 2:22] And, through union in him, you also are being built up together, to be a place where God lives through the Spirit.
[OEBcw - Eph 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - Eph 3:1] For this reason I, Paul, the prisoner of Jesus, the Christ, for the sake of you Gentiles —
[OEBcw - Eph 3:2] For you have heard, I suppose, of the responsible charge with which God entrusted me for your benefit,
[OEBcw - Eph 3:3] and also that it was by direct revelation that the hidden purpose of God was made known to me, as I have already briefly told you.
[OEBcw - Eph 3:4] And, by reading what I have written, you will be able to judge how far I understand this hidden purpose of God in Christ.
[OEBcw - Eph 3:5] In former generations it was not made known to humanity, as fully as it has now been revealed by the Spirit to the apostles and prophets among Christ’s people —
[OEBcw - Eph 3:6] That, by union with Christ Jesus and through the good news, the Gentiles are coheirs with us and members of one body, and that they share with us in God’s Promise.
[OEBcw - Eph 3:7] Of this good news I became a minister, in virtue of the charge with which God entrusted me in the exercise of his power —
[OEBcw - Eph 3:8] Yes, to me, who am less than the least of all Christ’s people, was this charge entrusted! — to tell the Gentiles the good news of the boundless wealth to be found in the Christ,
[OEBcw - Eph 3:9] and to make clear what is God’s way of working out that hidden purpose which from the first has been concealed in the mind of the Creator of all things;
[OEBcw - Eph 3:10] so that now to the archangels and to all the powers on high should be made known, through the church, the all-embracing wisdom of God,
[OEBcw - Eph 3:11] in accordance with that purpose which runs through all the ages and which he has now accomplished in Jesus, the Christ, our Master.
[OEBcw - Eph 3:12] And in union with him, and through our trust in him, we find courage to approach God with confidence.
[OEBcw - Eph 3:13] Therefore I beg you not to be disheartened at the sufferings that I am undergoing for your sakes; for they redound to your honour.
[OEBcw - Eph 3:14] For this reason, then, I kneel before the Father —
[OEBcw - Eph 3:15] From whom all ‘fatherhood’ in heaven and on earth derives its name —
[OEBcw - Eph 3:16] And pray that, in proportion to the wealth of his glory, he will strengthen you with his power by breathing his Spirit into your inmost soul,
[OEBcw - Eph 3:17] so that the Christ, through your faith, may make his home within your hearts in love; And I pray that you, now firmly rooted and established, may, with all Christ’s people,
[OEBcw - Eph 3:18] have the power to comprehend in all its width and length and height and depth,
[OEBcw - Eph 3:19] and to understand — though it surpasses all understanding — the love of the Christ; and so be filled to the full with God himself.
[OEBcw - Eph 3:20] To him who, through his power which is at work within us, is able to do far more than anything that we can ask or conceive —
[OEBcw - Eph 3:21] To him be all glory through the church and through Christ Jesus, for all generations, age after age. Amen.
[OEBcw - Eph 4 - start] 
[OEBcw - Eph 4:1] I beg you, then — I who am a prisoner in the Master’s cause — ​to live lives worthy of the call that you have received;
[OEBcw - Eph 4:2] always humble and gentle, patient, bearing lovingly with one another,
[OEBcw - Eph 4:3] and striving to maintain in the bond of peace the unity given by the Spirit.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:4] There is but one body and one Spirit, just as there was but one hope set before you when you received your call.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:5] There is but one Lord, one faith, one baptism.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:6] There is but one God and Father of all — the God who is over all, pervades all, and is in all.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:7] Everyone of us, however, has been entrusted with some charge, each in accordance with the extent of the gift of the Christ.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:8] That is why it is said — ‘When he went up on high, he led his captives into captivity. And gave gifts to humanity.’
[OEBcw - Eph 4:9] Now surely this ‘going up’ must imply that he had already gone down into the world beneath.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:10] He who went down is the same as he who went up — up beyond the highest heaven, so that he might fill all things with his presence.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:11] And he it is who gave to the church apostles, prophets, Missionaries, Pastors, and teachers,
[OEBcw - Eph 4:12] to fit his people for the work of the ministry, for the building up of the body of the Christ.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:13] And this will continue, until we all attain to that unity which is given by faith and by a fuller knowledge of the Son of God; until we reach maturity — the full standard of the perfection of the Christ.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:14] Then we will no longer be like infants, tossed backward and forward, blown about by every breath of human teaching and by people's trickery and craftiness;
[OEBcw - Eph 4:15] but holding the truth in a spirit of love, we will grow into complete union with him who is our head — Christ himself.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:16] For from him the whole body, closely joined and knit together by the contact of every part with the source of its life, derives its power to grow, in proportion to the vigour of each individual part; and so is being built up in a spirit of love.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:17] This, then, as one in union with the Lord, I implore: Do not continue to live such purposeless lives as the Gentiles live,
[OEBcw - Eph 4:18] with their powers of discernment darkened, cut off from the life of God, owing to the ignorance that prevails among them and to the hardness of their hearts.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:19] Lost to all sense of shame, they have abandoned themselves to licentiousness, in order to practice every kind of impurity without restraint.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:20] But far different is the lesson you learned from the Christ — ​if, that is, you really listened to him,
[OEBcw - Eph 4:21] and through union with him were taught the truth, as it is to be found in Jesus.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:22] For you learned with regard to your former way of living that you must cast off your old nature, which, yielding to deluding passions, grows corrupt;
[OEBcw - Eph 4:23] that the ​spirit of your minds must be constantly renewed;
[OEBcw - Eph 4:24] and that you must clothe yourselves in that new nature which was created to resemble God, with the righteousness and holiness springing from the truth.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:25] Since, therefore, you have cast off what is false, ‘you must every one of you speak the truth to your neighbours.’ For we are united to one another like the parts of a body.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:26] ‘Be angry, yet do not sin.’ Do not let the sun go down on your anger;
[OEBcw - Eph 4:27] and give no opportunity to the devil.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:28] Let the person who steals steal no longer, but rather let them toil with their hands at honest work, so that they may have something to share with anyone in need.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:29] Never let any foul word pass your lips, but only such good words as the occasion demands, so that they may be a help to those who hear them.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:30] And do not grieve God’s Holy Spirit; for it was through that Spirit that God sealed you as his, against the day of Redemption.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:31] Let all bitterness, passion, anger, brawling, and abusive language be banished from among you, as well as all malice.
[OEBcw - Eph 4:32] Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, ready to forgive one another, just as God, in Christ, forgave you.
[OEBcw - Eph 5 - start] 
[OEBcw - Eph 5:1] Therefore imitate God, as his dear children,
[OEBcw - Eph 5:2] and live a life of love, following the example of the Christ, who loved you and gave himself for you as ‘an offering and a sacrifice to God, that should be fragrant and acceptable.’
[OEBcw - Eph 5:3] As for sexual immorality and every kind of impurity, or greed, do not let them even be mentioned among you, as befits Christ’s people,
[OEBcw - Eph 5:4] nor shameful conduct, nor foolish talk or jesting, for they are wholly out of place among you; but rather thanksgiving.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:5] For of this you may be sure — that no one who is unchaste or impure or greedy of gain (for to be greedy of gain is idolatry) has any place awaiting him in the kingdom of the Christ and God.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:6] Do not let anyone deceive you with specious arguments. Those are the sins that bring down the wrath of God on the disobedient.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:7] Therefore have nothing to do with such people.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:8] For, although you were once in darkness, now, by your union with the Lord, you are in the light. Live as ‘children of light’ —
[OEBcw - Eph 5:9] For the outcome of life in the light may be seen in every form of goodness, righteousness, and sincerity —
[OEBcw - Eph 5:10] Always trying to find out what is pleasing to the Lord.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:11] Take no part in deeds of darkness, from which no good can come; on the contrary, expose them.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:12] It is degrading even to speak of the things continually done by them in secret.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:13] All such actions, when exposed, have their true character made manifest by the light.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:14] For everything that has its true character made manifest is clear as light. And that is why it is said — ‘Sleeper, awake! Arise from the dead, And the Christ will give you light!’
[OEBcw - Eph 5:15] Take great care, then, how you live — not unwisely but wisely,
[OEBcw - Eph 5:16] making the most of every opportunity; for these are evil days.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:17] Therefore do not grow thoughtless, but try to understand what the Lord’s will is.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:18] Do not drink wine to excess, for that leads to profligacy; but seek to be filled with the Spirit of God, and speak to one another in psalms and hymns and sacred songs.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:19] Sing and make music in your hearts to the Lord.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:20] Always give thanks for everything to our God and Father, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
[OEBcw - Eph 5:21] and submit to one another because you honour and respect him.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:22] Wives should submit to their husbands as submitting to the Lord.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:23] For a man is the head of his wife, as the Christ is the head of the church — being indeed himself the Saviour of his body.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:24] But as the church submits to the Christ, so also should wives submit to their husbands in everything.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:25] Husbands, love your wives, just as the Christ loved the church, and gave himself for her,
[OEBcw - Eph 5:26] to make her holy, after purifying her by the washing with the water, according to his promise;
[OEBcw - Eph 5:27] so that he might himself bring the church, in all her beauty, into his own presence, with no spot or wrinkle or blemish of any kind, but that she might be holy and faultless.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:28] That is how husbands ought to love their wives — as if they were their own bodies. A man who loves his wife is really loving himself;
[OEBcw - Eph 5:29] for no one ever yet hated his own body. But everyone feeds his body and cares for it, just as the Christ for the church;
[OEBcw - Eph 5:30] for we are members of his body.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:31] ‘For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and be united to his wife; and the man and his wife will become one.’
[OEBcw - Eph 5:32] In this there is a profound truth — I am speaking of Christ and his church.
[OEBcw - Eph 5:33] However, for you individually, let each love his wife as if she were himself; and the wife be careful to respect her husband.
[OEBcw - Eph 6 - start] 
[OEBcw - Eph 6:1] children, obey your parents, as children of the Lord; for that is but right.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:2] ‘Honour your father and mother’ — this is the first Commandment with a promise —
[OEBcw - Eph 6:3] ‘So that you may prosper and have a long life on earth.’
[OEBcw - Eph 6:4] And fathers, do not irritate your children, but bring them up with Christian discipline and instruction.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:5] Slaves, obey your earthly masters, with anxious care, giving them ungrudging service, as if obeying the Christ;
[OEBcw - Eph 6:6] not only when their eyes are on you, as if you had merely to please people, but as slaves of Christ, who are trying to carry out the will of God.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:7] Give your service heartily and cheerfully, as working for the Master and not for people;
[OEBcw - Eph 6:8] for you know that everyone will be rewarded by the Master for any honest work that he has done, whether he is a slave or free.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:9] And masters, treat your slaves in the same spirit. Give up threatening them; for you know that he who is both their Master and yours is in heaven, and that before him there is no distinction of rank.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:10] For the future, find strength in your union with the Lord, and in the power which comes from his might.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:11] Put on the full armour of God, so that you may be able to stand your ground against the stratagems of the devil.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:12] For ours is no struggle against enemies of flesh and blood, but against all the various powers of evil that hold sway in the darkness around us, against the spirits of Wickedness on high.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:13] Therefore take up the full armour of God, so that when the evil day comes, you may be able to withstand the attack, and, having fought to the end, still to stand your ground.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:14] Stand your ground, then, ‘with truth for your belt,’ and ‘with righteousness for your breast-plate,’
[OEBcw - Eph 6:15] And with the readiness to serve the good news of peace as shoes for your feet.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:16] At every onslaught take up faith for your shield; for with it you will be able to extinguish all the flaming darts of the evil one.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:17] And receive ‘the helmet of salvation,’ and ‘the sword of the Spirit’ — which is the message of God — always with prayer and supplication.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:18] Pray in spirit at all times. Be intent on this, with unwearying perseverance and supplication for all Christ’s people —
[OEBcw - Eph 6:19] And on my behalf also, so that when I begin to speak, words may be given me, so that I may fearlessly make known the inmost truth of the good news,
[OEBcw - Eph 6:20] on behalf of which I am an ambassador — in chains! Pray that, in telling it, I may speak fearlessly as I ought.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:21] To enable you, as well as others, to know all that concerns me and what I am doing, Tychicus, our dear friend and faithful helper in the Master’s cause, will tell you everything.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:22] I am sending him to you on purpose that you may learn all about us, and that he may cheer your hearts.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:23] May God, the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ give every follower peace, and love linked with faith.
[OEBcw - Eph 6:24] May God’s blessing be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with an undying love.
[OEBcw - Phil 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - Phil 1:1] To all Christ’s people at Philippi, with the presiding officers and assistants, from Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:2] May God, our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ bless you, and give you peace.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:3] Every recollection that I have of you is a cause of thankfulness to God,
[OEBcw - Phil 1:4] always, in every prayer that I offer for you all — my prayers are full of joy —
[OEBcw - Phil 1:5] Because of the share that you have had in spreading the good news, from the first day that you received it until now.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:6] For of this I am confident, that he who began a good work in you will complete it in readiness for the day of Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:7] And, indeed, I am justified in feeling like this about you all; because you have a warm place in my heart — you who all, both in my imprisonment and in the work of defending and establishing the good news, shared my privilege with me.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:8] God will bear me witness how I yearn over you all with the tenderness of Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:9] And what I pray for is this — that your love may grow yet stronger and stronger, with increasing knowledge and all discernment,
[OEBcw - Phil 1:10] until you are able to appreciate all moral distinctions. And I pray, too, that you may be kept pure and blameless against the day of Christ,
[OEBcw - Phil 1:11] bearing a rich harvest of that righteousness which comes through Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:12] Friends, I want you to realise that what has happened to me has actually served to forward the good news.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:13] It has even become evident, not only to all the imperial guard, but to everyone else, that it is for Christ’s sake that I am in chains.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:14] And besides this, most of our fellow followers have gained confidence in the Lord through my chains, and now venture with far greater freedom to speak of God’s message fearlessly.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:15] It is true that some do proclaim the Christ out of Jealousy and opposition; but there are others who proclaim him from goodwill.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:16] The latter do it from love for me, knowing that I have been appointed to plead the cause of the good news.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:17] The former spread the news of the Christ in a factious spirit, and not sincerely, thinking to add to the pain of my chains.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:18] But what of that? Only that in some way or other, either with assumed or with real earnestness, Christ is being made known; and at that I rejoice.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:19] Yes, and I will rejoice, for I know that, through your prayers and through a rich supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ, ‘all this will make for my salvation.’
[OEBcw - Phil 1:20] And this will fulfil my earnest expectation and hope that I will have no cause for shame, but that, with unfailing courage, now as hitherto, Christ will be honoured in my body, whether by my life or by my death,
[OEBcw - Phil 1:21] for to me life is Christ, and death is gain.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:22] But what if the life here in the body — if this brings me fruit from my labours? Then which to choose I cannot tell! I am sorely perplexed either way!
[OEBcw - Phil 1:23] My own desire is to depart and be with Christ, for this would be far better.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:24] But, for your sakes, it may be more needful that I should still remain here in the body.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:25] Yes, I am confident that this is so, and therefore I am sure that I will stay, and stay near you all, to promote your progress and joy in the faith;
[OEBcw - Phil 1:26] so that, when you once more have me among you, you, in your union with Christ Jesus, may find in me fresh cause for exultation.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:27] Under all circumstances let your lives be worthy of the good news of the Christ: so that, whether I come and see you, or whether I hear of your affairs at a distance, I may know that you are standing firm, animated by one spirit, and joining with one heart in a common struggle for the faith taught by the good news,
[OEBcw - Phil 1:28] without ever shrinking from your opponents. To them this will be a sign of their destruction and of your salvation — a sign from God.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:29] For, on behalf of Christ, you have had the privilege granted you, not only of trusting in him, but also of suffering on his behalf.
[OEBcw - Phil 1:30] You will be engaged in the same hard struggle as that which you once saw me waging, and which you hear that I am waging still.
[OEBcw - Phil 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - Phil 2:1] If, then, any encouragement comes through union with Christ, if there is any persuasive power in love, if there is any communion with the Spirit, if there is any tenderness or pity,
[OEBcw - Phil 2:2] I entreat you to make my happiness complete — Live together animated by the same spirit and in mutual love, one in heart, animated by one Spirit.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:3] Nothing should be done in a factious spirit or from vanity, but each of you should with all humility regard others as better than himself,
[OEBcw - Phil 2:4] and one and all should consider, not only their own interests, but also the interests of others.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:5] Let the spirit of Christ Jesus be yours also.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:6] Though the divine nature was his from the beginning, yet he did not look on equality with God as above all things to be clung to,
[OEBcw - Phil 2:7] but impoverished himself by taking the nature of a servant and becoming like one of us;
[OEBcw - Phil 2:8] he appeared among us as a man, and still further humbled himself by submitting even to death — to death on a cross!
[OEBcw - Phil 2:9] And that is why God raised him to the very highest place, and gave him the name which stands above all other names,
[OEBcw - Phil 2:10] so that in adoration of the name of Jesus every knee should bend, in heaven, on earth, and under the earth,
[OEBcw - Phil 2:11] and that every tongue should acknowledge JESUS CHRIST as LORD — to the glory of God the Father.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:12] Therefore, my dear friends, as you have always been obedient in the past, so now work out your own salvation with anxious care, not only when I am with you, but all the more now that I am absent.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:13] Remember it is God who, in his kindness, is at work within you, enabling you both to will and to work.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:14] In all that you do, avoid murmuring and dissension,
[OEBcw - Phil 2:15] so as to prove yourselves blameless and innocent — ​‘faultless children of God, in the midst of an evil-disposed and perverse generation,’ in which you are seen shining like stars in a dark world,
[OEBcw - Phil 2:16] offering to them the message of life; and then I will be able at the day of Christ to boast that I did not run my course for nothing, or toil for nothing.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:17] And yet, even if, when your faith is offered as a sacrifice to God, my lifeblood must be poured out in addition, still I will rejoice and share the joy of you all;
[OEBcw - Phil 2:18] and you must also rejoice and share my joy.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:19] I hope, however, as one who trusts in the Lord Jesus, to send Timothy to you before long, so that I may myself be cheered by receiving news of you.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:20] For I have no one but him to send — no one of kindred spirit who would take the same genuine interest in your welfare.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:21] They are all pursuing their own aims and not those of Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:22] But you know what Timothy has proved himself to be, and how, like a child working for his father, he worked hard with me in spreading the good news.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:23] It is Timothy, then, whom I hope to send, as soon as ever I can foresee how it will go with me.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:24] And I am confident, as one who trusts in the Lord Jesus, that before long I myself will follow.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:25] Still I think it necessary to send Epaphroditus to you now, for he is my dear friend, fellow worker, and fellow soldier, and he was also your messenger to help me in my need.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:26] For he has been longing to see you all, and has been distressed because you heard of his illness.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:27] And I can assure you that his illness very nearly proved fatal. But God had pity on him, and not on him only but also on me, so that I might not have sorrow on sorrow.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:28] I am all the more ready, therefore, to send him, so that the sight of him may revive your spirits and my own sorrow be lightened.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:29] Give him, then, the heartiest of Christian welcomes, and hold such people in great honour.
[OEBcw - Phil 2:30] For it was owing to his devotion to the Master’s work that he was at the point of death, having risked his own life in the effort to supply what was wanting in the help that you sent me.
[OEBcw - Phil 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - Phil 3:1] In conclusion, my friends, all joy be yours in your union with the Lord. To repeat what I have already written does not weary me, and is the safe course for you.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:2] Beware of those ‘dogs’! Beware of those mischievous workers! Beware of the men who mutilate themselves!
[OEBcw - Phil 3:3] For it is we who are the circumcised — we whose worship is prompted by the Spirit of God, who exult in Christ Jesus, and who do not rely on external privileges;
[OEBcw - Phil 3:4] though I, if anyone, have cause to rely even on them. If anyone thinks he can rely on external privileges, far more can I!
[OEBcw - Phil 3:5] I was circumcised when eight days old; I am an Israelite by race, and of the tribe of Benjamin; I am a Hebrew, and the child of Hebrews. As to the law, I was a Pharisee;
[OEBcw - Phil 3:6] as to zeal, I was a persecutor of the church; as to such righteousness as is due to law, I proved myself blameless.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:7] But all the things which I once held to be gains I have now, for the Christ’s sake, come to count as loss.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:8] More than that, I count everything as loss, for the sake of the exceeding value of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord. And for his sake I have lost everything, and count it as refuse, if I may but gain Christ and be found in union with him;
[OEBcw - Phil 3:9] any righteousness that I have being, not the righteousness that results from law, but the righteousness which comes through faith in Christ — the righteousness which is derived from God and is founded on faith.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:10] Then indeed I will know Christ, and the power of his resurrection, and all that it means to share his sufferings,
[OEBcw - Phil 3:11] in the hope that, if I become like him in death, I may possibly attain to the resurrection from the dead.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:12] Not that I have already laid hold of it, or that I am already made perfect. But I press on, in the hope of actually laying hold of that for which indeed I was laid hold of by Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:13] For I, friends, do not regard myself as having yet laid hold of it. But this one thing I do — forgetting what lies behind, and straining every nerve for that which lies in front,
[OEBcw - Phil 3:14] I press on to the goal, to gain the prize of that heavenward call which God gave me through Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:15] Let all of us, then, whose faith is mature, think this way. Then, if on any matter you think otherwise, God will make that also plain to you.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:16] Only we are bound to order our lives by what we have already attained.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:17] My friends, unite in following my example, and fix your eyes on those who are living by the pattern which we have set you.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:18] For there are many — of whom I have often told you, and now tell you even with tears — who are living in enmity to the cross of the Christ.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:19] The end of such people is ruin; for their appetites are their God, and they glory in their shame; their minds are given up to earthly things.
[OEBcw - Phil 3:20] But the State of which we are citizens is in heaven; and it is from heaven that we are eagerly looking for a Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ,
[OEBcw - Phil 3:21] who, by the exercise of his power to bring everything into subjection to himself, will make this body that we have in our humiliation like to that body which he has in his glory.
[OEBcw - Phil 4 - start] 
[OEBcw - Phil 4:1] So then, my dear friends, whom I am longing to see — you who are my joy and my crown, stand fast in union with the Lord, dear friends.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:2] I entreat Euodia, and I entreat Syntyche, to live in harmony, in union with the Lord;
[OEBcw - Phil 4:3] yes, and I ask you, my true comrade, to help them, remembering that they toiled by my side in spreading the good news; and so, too, did Clement and my other fellow workers, whose names are ‘in the book of life.’
[OEBcw - Phil 4:4] All joy be yours at all times in your union with the Lord. Again I repeat — All joy be yours.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:5] Let your forbearing spirit be plain to everyone. The Lord is near.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:6] Do not be anxious about anything; but under all circumstances, by prayer and entreaty joined with thanksgiving, make your needs known to God.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:7] Then the peace of God, which is beyond all human understanding, will stand guard over your hearts and thoughts, through your union with Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:8] In conclusion, friends, whenever you find things that are true or honourable, righteous or pure, loveable or praiseworthy, or if ‘virtue’ and ‘honour’ have any meaning, let them fill your thoughts.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:9] All that you learned and received and heard and saw in me put into practice continually; and then God, the giver of peace, will be with you.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:10] It was a matter of great joy to me, as one in union with the Lord, that at length your interest in me had revived. The interest indeed you had, but not the opportunity.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:11] Do not think that I am saying this under the pressure of want. For I, however I am placed, have learned to be independent of circumstances.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:12] I know how to face humble circumstances, and I know how to face prosperity. Into all and every human experience I have been initiated — into plenty and hunger, into prosperity and want.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:13] I can do everything in the strength of him who makes me strong!
[OEBcw - Phil 4:14] Yet you have acted nobly in sharing my troubles.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:15] And you at Philippi know, as well as I, that in the early days of the good news — at the time when I had just left Macedonia — no church, with the one exception of yourselves, had anything to do with me as far as giving and receiving are concerned.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:16] Indeed, even while I was still in Thessalonica, you sent more than once to relieve my wants.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:17] It is not that I am anxious for your gifts, but I am anxious to see the abundant return that will be placed to your account. I have enough of everything, and to spare.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:18] My wants are fully satisfied, now that I have received from Epaphroditus the gifts which you sent me — the sweet fragrance of a sacrifice acceptable and pleasing to God.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:19] And my God, out of the greatness of his wealth, will, in glory, fully satisfy your every need, through your union with Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:20] To him, our God and Father, be ascribed all glory for every and ever. Amen.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:21] Give my greeting to everyone of the people of Christ Jesus. The Lord's followers who are with me send your their greetings.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:22] All Christ’s people here, and especially those who belong to the Emperor’s household, send theirs.
[OEBcw - Phil 4:23] May the blessing of the Lord Jesus Christ rest on your souls.
[OEBcw - Col 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - Col 1:1] From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus, by the will of God, and from Timothy, also a follower of the Lord.
[OEBcw - Col 1:2] To Christ’s people at Colossae — the followers who are faithful to him: May God, our Father, bless you and give you peace.
[OEBcw - Col 1:3] Whenever we pray, we never fail to thank God, the Father of our Lord, Jesus Christ, about you,
[OEBcw - Col 1:4] now that we have heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love that you have for all his people,
[OEBcw - Col 1:5] because of the hope which awaits its fulfilment in heaven. Of this hope you heard long ago in the true message of the good news which reached you —
[OEBcw - Col 1:6] Bearing fruit and growing, as it does, through all the world, just as it did among you, from the very day that you heard of God’s loving kindness, and understood what that loving kindness really is.
[OEBcw - Col 1:7] It is just what you learned from Epaphras, our dear fellow servant, who, as a minister of the Christ, faithfully represents us,
[OEBcw - Col 1:8] and who told us of the love with which the Spirit has inspired you.
[OEBcw - Col 1:9] And therefore we, from the very day that we heard this, have never ceased praying for you, or asking that you may possess that deeper knowledge of the will of God, which comes through all true spiritual wisdom and insight.
[OEBcw - Col 1:10] Then you will live lives worthy of the Master, and so please God in every way. Your lives will be fruitful in every kind of good action, and your characters will grow through a fuller knowledge of God;
[OEBcw - Col 1:11] you will be made strong at all points with a strength worthy of the power manifested in his glory — strong to endure with patience, and even with gladness, whatever may happen to you;
[OEBcw - Col 1:12] and you will give thanks to the Father who made you fit to share the lot which awaits Christ’s people in the realms of light.
[OEBcw - Col 1:13] For God has rescued us from the tyranny of darkness, and has removed us into the kingdom of his Son, who is the embodiment of his love,
[OEBcw - Col 1:14] and through whom we have found deliverance in the forgiveness of our sins.
[OEBcw - Col 1:15] For Christ is the ​incarnation of the invisible God — ​first-born and head of all creation;
[OEBcw - Col 1:16] for in him was created all that is in heaven and on earth, the visible and the invisible — angels and archangels and all the powers of heaven.
[OEBcw - Col 1:17] All has been created through him and for him. He was before all things, and all things unite in him;
[OEBcw - Col 1:18] and he is the head of the church, which is his body. The first-born from the dead, he is to the church the Source of its life, that he, in all things, may stand first.
[OEBcw - Col 1:19] For it pleased the Father that in him the divine nature in all its fulness should live,
[OEBcw - Col 1:20] and through him to reconcile all things to himself (making peace by the shedding of Christ’s blood offered on the cross) — ​whether on earth or in heaven.
[OEBcw - Col 1:21] And it pleased God that you, once estranged from him and hostile towards him in your thoughts, intent only on wickedness —
[OEBcw - Col 1:22] But now he has reconciled you to himself by the sacrifice of Christ’s earthly body in death — it has pleased God that you should stand in his presence holy, pure, and blameless,
[OEBcw - Col 1:23] if only you remain true to your faith, firm and immovable, never abandoning the hope held out in the good news to which you listened, which has been proclaimed among all created things under heaven, and of which I, Paul, was made a minister.
[OEBcw - Col 1:24] Now at last I can rejoice in my sufferings on your behalf, and in my own person I supplement the afflictions endured by the Christ, for the sake of his body, the church;
[OEBcw - Col 1:25] of which I myself became a minister in virtue of the office with which God entrusted me for your benefit, to declare the message of God in all its fulness —
[OEBcw - Col 1:26] That truth which has been hidden from former ages and generations. But now it has been revealed to God’s people,
[OEBcw - Col 1:27] to whom it was his pleasure to make known the surpassing glory of that hidden truth when proclaimed among the Gentiles — ‘Christ among you! Your hope of glory!’
[OEBcw - Col 1:28] This is the Christ whom we proclaim, warning everyone, and instructing everyone, with all the wisdom that we possess, in the hope of bringing everyone into God’s presence perfected by union with Christ.
[OEBcw - Col 1:29] It is for that I toil, struggling with all the energy which he inspires and which works powerfully within me.
[OEBcw - Col 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - Col 2:1] I want you to know in how great a struggle I am engaged for you and for Christ’s people at Laodicea, and for all who have not yet seen me;
[OEBcw - Col 2:2] in the hope that they, being bound to one another by love, and keeping in view the full blessedness of a firm conviction, may be encouraged to strive for a perfect knowledge of God’s hidden truth,
[OEBcw - Col 2:3] even Christ himself, in whom all treasures of wisdom and knowledge lie hidden.
[OEBcw - Col 2:4] I say this to prevent anyone from deceiving you by plausible arguments.
[OEBcw - Col 2:5] It is true that I am not with you in person, but I am with you in spirit, and am glad to see the good order and the unbroken front resulting from your faith in Christ.
[OEBcw - Col 2:6] Since, therefore, you have received Jesus, the Christ, as your Lord, live your lives in union with him —
[OEBcw - Col 2:7] rooted in him, building up your characters through union with him, growing stronger through your faith, as you were taught, overflowing with faith and thanksgiving.
[OEBcw - Col 2:8] Take care there is not some one who will carry you away by his ‘philosophy’ — a hollow sham! — following, as it does, mere human traditions, and dealing with puerile questions of this world, and not with Christ.
[OEBcw - Col 2:9] For in Christ the Godhead in all its fulness dwells incarnate;
[OEBcw - Col 2:10] and, by your union with him, you also are filled with it. He is the head of all archangels and powers of heaven.
[OEBcw - Col 2:11] By your union with him you received a circumcision that was not performed by human hands, when you threw off the tyranny of the earthly body, and received the circumcision of the Christ.
[OEBcw - Col 2:12] For in baptism you were buried with Christ; and in baptism you were also raised to life with him, through your faith in the omnipotence of God, who raised him from the dead.
[OEBcw - Col 2:13] And to you, who once were ‘dead,’ by reason of your sins and your uncircumcised nature — to you God gave life in giving life to Christ! He pardoned all our sins!
[OEBcw - Col 2:14] He canceled the bond which stood against us — the bond that consisted of ordinances — and which was directly hostile to us! He has taken it out of our way by nailing it to the cross!
[OEBcw - Col 2:15] He rid himself of all the powers of evil, and held them up to open contempt, when he celebrated his triumph over them on the cross!
[OEBcw - Col 2:16] Do not, then, allow anyone to take you to task on questions of eating or drinking, or in the matter of annual or monthly or weekly festivals.
[OEBcw - Col 2:17] These things are only the shadow of what is to come; the substance is in the Christ.
[OEBcw - Col 2:18] Do not let anyone defraud you of the reality by affecting delight in so-called ‘humility’ and angel-worship. Such a person busies themselves with their visions, and without reason are rendered conceited by their merely human intellect.
[OEBcw - Col 2:19] They fail to maintain union with the head, to whom it is due that the whole body, nourished and knit together by the contact and connexion of every part, grows with a divine growth.
[OEBcw - Col 2:20] Since, with Christ, you became dead to the puerile teaching of this world, why do you submit, as as if you still belonged to the world,
[OEBcw - Col 2:21] to such ordinances as ‘Do not handle, or taste, or touch’?
[OEBcw - Col 2:22] For all the things referred to in them cease to exist when used. You are following mere human directions and instructions.
[OEBcw - Col 2:23] Such prohibitions appear reasonable where there is a desire for self-imposed service, and so-called ‘humility,’ and harsh treatment of the body, but are of no real value against the indulgence of our earthly nature.
[OEBcw - Col 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - Col 3:1] Since, therefore, you were raised to life with the Christ, seek for the things that are above; for it is there that the Christ is ‘seated at the right hand of God.’
[OEBcw - Col 3:2] Fix your thoughts on the things that are above, not on those that are on earth.
[OEBcw - Col 3:3] For you died, and your life now lies hidden, with the Christ, in God.
[OEBcw - Col 3:4] When the Christ, who is our life, appears, then you also will appear with him in glory.
[OEBcw - Col 3:5] Therefore destroy all that is earthly in you — immorality, uncleanness, passions, evil desires, and that greed which is idolatry.
[OEBcw - Col 3:6] These are the things because of which the wrath of God comes,
[OEBcw - Col 3:7] and to which you, like others, once devoted your lives, when you lived for them.
[OEBcw - Col 3:8] You, however, must now lay aside all such things — anger, passion, malice, slander, abuse.
[OEBcw - Col 3:9] Never lie to one another. Get rid of your old self and its habits,
[OEBcw - Col 3:10] and clothe yourselves with that new self, which, as it gains in knowledge, is being constantly renewed ‘in resemblance to him who made it.’
[OEBcw - Col 3:11] In that new life there is no distinction between Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave, free; but Christ is all! — and in all!
[OEBcw - Col 3:12] Therefore, as God’s people, consecrated and dear to him, clothe yourselves with tenderness of heart, kindliness, humility, gentleness, forbearance;
[OEBcw - Col 3:13] bearing with one another, and, when there is any ground for complaint, forgiving one another freely. As the Master freely forgave you, so you must forgive one another.
[OEBcw - Col 3:14] Over all these virtues put on love; for that is the girdle which makes all complete.
[OEBcw - Col 3:15] Let the peace that the Christ gives decide all doubts within your hearts; for you also were called to the enjoyment of peace as members of one body. And show yourselves thankful.
[OEBcw - Col 3:16] Let the message of the Christ be alive in your minds in all its wealth, bringing all wisdom with it. Teach and admonish one another with psalms, and hymns, and sacred songs, full of the loving kindness of God, lifting your hearts in song to him.
[OEBcw - Col 3:17] And, whatever you say or do, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus; and through him offer thanksgiving to God the father.
[OEBcw - Col 3:18] Wives, submit to your husbands, as befits those who belong to the Lord.
[OEBcw - Col 3:19] Husbands, love your wives, and never treat them harshly.
[OEBcw - Col 3:20] children, always obey your parents; for that is pleasant to see in those who belong to the Lord.
[OEBcw - Col 3:21] Fathers, never irritate your children, otherwise they might become disheartened.
[OEBcw - Col 3:22] Slaves, always obey your earthly masters, not only when their eyes are on you, as if you had but to please people alone, but giving them ungrudging service, in your respect for the Master.
[OEBcw - Col 3:23] Whatever you do, do it with all your heart, as if working for the Master and not for people,
[OEBcw - Col 3:24] since you know that it is from the Master that you will receive the inheritance which will be your reward. You are serving Christ, the Master.
[OEBcw - Col 3:25] Those who do wrong will reap the wrong they have done; and there will be no partiality.
[OEBcw - Col 4 - start] 
[OEBcw - Col 4:1] Masters, do what is right and fair by your slaves, for you know that you also have a Master — in heaven.
[OEBcw - Col 4:2] Devote yourselves to prayer. Give your whole mind to it, and also offer thanksgiving;
[OEBcw - Col 4:3] and at the same time pray for us, so that God may give us an opening for our message, so that we may speak of the truths hidden in the Christ — the truths for which I am in chains!
[OEBcw - Col 4:4] Then I will make them known, as I ought to do.
[OEBcw - Col 4:5] Show tact in your behaviour to the outside world, making the most of every opportunity.
[OEBcw - Col 4:6] Let your conversation always be kindly, but not bland, season it, as it were, with salt; be aware in each case of the answer you should be giving.
[OEBcw - Col 4:7] Our dear friend, Tychicus, will tell you all about me. He is a faithful minister, and a fellow servant in the Master’s cause.
[OEBcw - Col 4:8] I send him to you expressly that you may learn our circumstances, and that he may give you encouragement.
[OEBcw - Col 4:9] With him will be Onesimus, our dear faithful friend, who is one of yourselves. They will tell you all that is going on here.
[OEBcw - Col 4:10] My fellow prisoner, Aristarchus, sends you his greeting, and Barnabas’s cousin, Mark, sends his. (You have received directions about him. If he comes to you, make him welcome.)
[OEBcw - Col 4:11] Joshua, who is called Justus, also sends his greeting. These are the only converts from Judaism who have worked with me for the kingdom of God; I have found them a great comfort.
[OEBcw - Col 4:12] Epaphras, who is one of yourselves, sends you his greeting. He is a servant of Christ Jesus, and is always most earnest in your behalf in his prayers, praying that you may stand firm, with a matured faith and with a sure conviction of all that is in accordance with God’s will.
[OEBcw - Col 4:13] I can bear testimony to the deep interest he takes in you, as well as in the followers at Laodicea and at Hierapolis.
[OEBcw - Col 4:14] Luke, our dear doctor, sends you his greeting, and Demas sends his.
[OEBcw - Col 4:15] Give my greeting to the followers at Laodicea, and to Nymphe, and to the church that meets at her house.
[OEBcw - Col 4:16] And when this letter has been read to you, see that it is also read before the church at Laodicea, and that you yourselves read the letter which will be forwarded from there.
[OEBcw - Col 4:17] Give this message to Archippus — ‘Take care to discharge to the best of your ability the office to which you were appointed in the Master’s cause.’
[OEBcw - Col 4:18] I, Paul, add this greeting in my own handwriting. Remember these chains of mine. God’s blessing be with you.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:1] To the Thessalonian church in union with God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, from Paul, Silas, and Timothy. May God bless you and give you peace.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:2] We always mention you in our prayers and thank God for you all;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:3] recalling continually before our God and Father the efforts that have resulted from your faith, the toil prompted by your love, and the patient endurance sustained by your hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:4] Friends, whom God loves, we know that he has chosen you,
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:5] because the good news that we brought came home to you, not merely as so many words, but with a power and a fulness of conviction due to the Holy Spirit. For you know the life that we lived among you for your good.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:6] And you yourselves began to follow, not only our example, but the Master’s also; and, in spite of much suffering, you welcomed the message with a joy inspired by the Holy Spirit,
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:7] and so became a pattern to all who believed in Christ throughout Macedonia and Greece.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:8] For it was from you that the Lord’s message resounded throughout Macedonia and Greece; and, more than that, your faith in God has become known far and wide; so that there is no need for us to say another word.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:9] Indeed, in speaking about us, the people themselves tell of the reception you gave us, and how, turning to God from your idols, you became servants of the true and living God,
[OEBcw - 1Thess 1:10] and are now awaiting the return from heaven of his Son whom he raised from the dead — Jesus, our deliverer from the coming wrath.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:1] Yes, friends, you yourselves know that your reception of us was not without result.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:2] For, although we had experienced suffering and ill treatment, as you know, at Philippi, we had the courage, by the help of our God, to tell you God’s good news in spite of great opposition.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:3] Our appeal to you was not based on a delusion, nor was it made from unworthy motives, or with any intention of misleading you.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:4] But, having been found worthy by God to be entrusted with the good news, therefore we tell it; with a view to please, not people, but God who proves our hearts.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:5] Never at any time, as you know, did we use the language of flattery, or make false professions in order to hide selfish aims. God will bear witness to that.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:6] Nor did we seek to win honour from people, whether from you or from others, although, as apostles of Christ, we might have burdened you with our support.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:7] But we lived among you with the simplicity of a child; we were like a woman nursing her own children.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:8] In our strong affection for you, that seemed to us the best way of sharing with you, not only God’s Good news, but our ​lives as well — so dear had you become to us.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:9] You will not have forgotten, friends, our labour and toil. Night and day we used to work at our trades, so as not be a burden to any of you, while we proclaimed to you God’s good news.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:10] You will bear witness, and God also, that our relations with you who believed in Christ were pure, and upright, and beyond reproach.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:11] Indeed, you know that, like a father with his own children, we used to encourage and comfort every one of you, and solemnly plead with you;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:12] so that you should make your daily lives worthy of God who is calling you into the glory of his kingdom.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:13] This, too, is a reason why we, on our part, are continually thanking God — because, in receiving the teaching that you had from us, you accepted it, not as the teaching of humans, but as what it really is — the teaching of God, which is even now doing its work within you who believe in Christ.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:14] For you, friends, began to follow the example of the churches of God in Judea which are in union with Jesus Christ; you, in your turn, suffering at the hands of your fellow citizens, in the same way as those churches did at the hands of of their people —
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:15] who killed both the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and persecuted us also. They do not try to please God, and they are enemies to all humanity,
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:16] for they try to prevent us from speaking to the Gentiles with a view to their salvation, and so are always ‘filling up the measure of their iniquity.’ But the wrath of God has come upon them to the full!
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:17] As for ourselves, friends, our having been bereaved of you even for a short time — though in body only, and not in spirit — made us all the more eager to see your faces again; and the longing to do so was strong on us.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:18] That was why we made up our minds to go and see you — at least I, Paul, did, more than once — but Satan put difficulties in our way.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:19] For what hope or joy will be ours, or what crown will we have to boast of, in the presence of our Lord Jesus, at his coming, if it be not you?
[OEBcw - 1Thess 2:20] You are our pride and our delight!
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:1] And so, as we could bear it no longer, we made up our minds to remain behind alone at Athens,
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:2] and sent Timothy, our dear friend and God’s minister of the good news of the Christ, to strengthen you, and to encourage you in your faith,
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:3] so that none of you should be shaken by the troubles through which you are passing. You yourselves know that we are destined to meet with such things.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:4] For, even while we were with you, we warned you beforehand that we were certain to encounter trouble. And so it proved, as you know.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:5] Therefore, since I could no longer endure the uncertainty, I sent to make inquiries about your faith, fearing that the Tempter had tempted you, and that our toil might prove to have been in vain.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:6] But, when Timothy recently returned to us from you with good news of your faith and love, and told us how kindly you think of us — always longing, he said, to see us, just as we are longing to see you —
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:7] on hearing this, we felt encouraged about you, friends, in the midst of all our difficulties and troubles, by your faith.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:8] For it is new life to us to know that you are holding fast to the Lord.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:9] How can we thank God enough for all the happiness that you are giving us in the sight of our God?
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:10] Night and day we pray most earnestly that we may see you face to face, and make good any deficiency in your faith.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:11] May our God and Father himself, and Jesus, our Lord, make the way plain for us to come to you.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:12] And for you, may the Lord fill you to overflowing with love for one another and for everyone, just as we are filled with love for you;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 3:13] and so make your hearts strong, and your lives pure beyond reproach, in the sight of our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus, with all his Holy Ones.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:1] Further, friends, we beg and urge you in the name of our Lord Jesus to carry out more fully than ever — as indeed you are already doing — all that you have heard from us as to what your daily life must be, if it is to please God.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:2] For you have not forgotten the directions that we gave you on the authority of our Lord Jesus.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:3] For this is God’s purpose — that you should be pure; abstaining from all immorality;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:4] each of you learning to gain control over your own body, in a way that is holy and honourable,
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:5] and not for the mere gratification of your passions, like the Gentiles who know nothing of God;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:6] none of you overreaching or taking advantage of their fellow follower of the Lord in such matters. ‘The Lord takes vengeance’ on all who do such things, as we have already warned you and solemnly declared.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:7] For God’s call to us does not permit of an impure life, but demands purity.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:8] Therefore the person who disregards this warning disregards, not people, but God who gives you his Holy Spirit.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:9] As to love for each other there is no need to write to you; for you have yourselves been taught by God to love one another;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:10] and indeed you do act in this spirit towards all his people throughout Macedonia. Yet, friends, we beg you to do even more.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:11] Make it your ambition to live quietly, and to attend to your own business, and to work with your hands, as we directed you;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:12] so that your conduct may win respect from those outside the church, and that you may not want for anything.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:13] We don't want you to be ignorant, friends, about those who have passed to their rest. We don't want you to grieve like other people who have no hope.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:14] For, as we believe that Jesus died and rose again, so also we believe that God will bring, with Jesus, those who through him have passed to their rest.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:15] This we tell you on the authority of the Lord — that those of us who are still living at the coming of the Lord will not anticipate those who have passed to their rest.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:16] For, with a loud summons, with the shout of an archangel, and with the trumpet-call of God, the Lord himself will come down from heaven.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:17] Then those who died in union with Christ will rise first; and afterwards we who are still living will be caught up in the clouds, with them, to meet the Lord in the air; and so we will be for ever with the Lord.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 4:18] Therefore, comfort one another with what I have told you.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:1] But as to the times and the moments, there is no need, friends, for anyone to write to you.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:2] You yourselves know well that the day of the Lord will come just as a thief comes in the night.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:3] When people are saying ‘All is quiet and safe,’ it is then that, like birth pains on a pregnant woman, ruin comes suddenly upon them, and there will be no escape!
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:4] You, however, friends, are not in darkness, that the daylight should take you by surprise as if you were thieves.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:5] For you all are ‘sons of light’ and ‘sons of the day.’ We have nothing to do with night, or darkness.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:6] Therefore let us not sleep as others do. No, let us be watchful and self-controlled.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:7] It is at night that people sleep, and at night that drunkards get drunk.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:8] But let us, who belong to the day, control ourselves, and put on faith and love as a breast plate, and the hope of salvation as a helmet.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:9] For God destined us, not for wrath, but to win salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ, who died for us,
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:10] that, whether we are still watching or have fallen asleep, we may live with him.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:11] Therefore encourage one another, and try to build up one another’s characters, as indeed you are doing.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:12] We beg you, friends, to value those who toil among you, and are your leaders in the Lord’s service, and give you counsel.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:13] Hold them in the very greatest esteem and affection for the sake of their work. Live at peace with one another.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:14] We entreat you also, friends — warn the disorderly, comfort the faint-hearted, give a helping hand to the weak, and be patient with everyone.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:15] Take care that none of you ever pays back wrong for wrong, but always follow the kindest course with one another and with everyone.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:16] Always be joyful;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:17] never cease to pray;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:18] under all circumstances give thanks to God. For this is his will for you as made known in Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:19] Do not quench the Spirit;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:20] do not make light of preaching.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:21] Bring everything to the test; cling to what is good;
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:22] shun every form of evil.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:23] May God himself, the giver of peace, make you altogether holy; and may your spirits, souls, and bodies be kept altogether faultless until the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:24] He who calls you will not fail you; he will complete his work.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:25] Friends, pray for us.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:26] Greet all the Lord's followers with a sacred kiss.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:27] I order you in the Lord’s name to have this letter read to all the brethren.
[OEBcw - 1Thess 5:28] May the blessing of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:1] To the Thessalonian church in union with God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, From Paul, Silas, and Timothy.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:2] May God, the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ bless you and give you peace.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:3] Friends, it is our duty always to thank God about you, as is but right, considering the wonderful growth of your faith, and because, without exception, your love for one another is continually increasing.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:4] So much is this the case that we ourselves speak with pride, before the churches of God, of the patience and faith which you have shown, in spite of all the persecutions and troubles that you are enduring.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:5] These persecutions will vindicate the justice of God’s judgment, and will result in your being reckoned worthy of God’s kingdom, for the sake of which you are now suffering;
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:6] since God deems it just to inflict suffering on those who are now inflicting suffering on you,
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:7] and to give relief to you who are suffering, as well as to us, at the appearing of the Lord Jesus from heaven with his mighty angels, ‘in flaming fire.’
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:8] Then he will ‘inflict punishment on those who refuse to know God, and on those who turn a deaf ear’ to the good news of Jesus, our Lord.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:9] They will pay the penalty of unutterable ruin — banished ‘from the presence of the Lord and from the glorious manifestation of his might,
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:10] when he comes to be honour ed in his people,’ and to be revered in all who have learned to believe in him (for you also believed our testimony) — as he will be on ‘that day.’
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:11] With this in view, our constant prayer for you is that our God may count you worthy of the call that you have received, and by his power make perfect your delight in all goodness and the efforts that have resulted from your faith.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 1:12] Then, in the loving kindness of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ, will the name of Jesus, our Lord, be honoured in you, and you in him.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:1] As to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and our being gathered to meet him, we beg you, friends,
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:2] not lightly to let your minds become unsettled, nor yet to be disturbed by any revelation, or by any message, or by any letter, purporting to come from us, to the effect that the day of the Lord is come.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:3] Do not let anyone deceive you, whatever he may do. For it will not come until after the Great Apostasy, and the appearing of that Incarnation of Wickedness, that the Lost soul,
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:4] who so opposes himself to everyone that is spoken of as a God or as an object of worship, and so exalts himself above them, that he seats himself in the Temple of God, and displays himself as God!
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:5] Do not you remember how, when I was with you, I used to speak to you of all this?
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:6] And you know now what the restraining influence is which prevents his appearing before his appointed time.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:7] Wickedness, indeed, is already at work in secret; but only until he who at present restrains it is removed out of the way.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:8] Then will ‘Wickedness Incarnate’ appear, but the Lord Jesus will destroy him with the breath of his lips, and annihilate him by the splendour of his coming.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:9] For at the coming of the Lord there will be great activity on the part of Satan, in the form of all kinds of deceptive miracles, signs, and marvels, as well as of wicked attempts to delude —
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:10] to the ruin of those who are on the path to destruction, because they have never received and loved the truth to their own salvation.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:11] That is why God places them under the influence of a delusion, to cause them to believe a lie;
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:12] so that sentence may be passed on all those who refuse to believe the truth, but delight in wickedness.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:13] But, friends, whom the Lord loves, it is our duty always to thank God about you, for, from the first, God chose you for salvation through the purifying influence of the Spirit, and your belief in the truth.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:14] To this you were called by the good news which we brought you, to attain to the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:15] Stand firm then, friends, and hold fast to the truths that we taught you, whether by word or by letter.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:16] And may our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father, who loved us and, in his loving kindness, gave us unfailing consolation and good ground for hope,
[OEBcw - 2Thess 2:17] console your hearts, and strengthen you to do and to say all that is right.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:1] In conclusion, friends, pray for us — pray that the Lord’s message may spread rapidly, and be received everywhere with honour, as it was among you;
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:2] and that we may be preserved from wrong-headed and wicked people — for it is not everyone who believes in Christ.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:3] But the Lord will not fail you; he will give you strength, and guard you from evil.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:4] Yes, and the confidence that our union with the Lord enables us to place in you leads us to believe that you are doing, and will do, what we direct you.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:5] May the Lord bring you to the love of God, and to the patience of the Christ.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:6] We beg you, friends, in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, to avoid any follower who is living an ill-ordered life, which is not in agreement with the teaching that you received from us.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:7] For you know well that you ought to follow our example. When we were with you, our life was not ill-ordered,
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:8] nor did we eat anyone’s bread without paying for it. Night and day, labouring and toiling, we used to work at our trades, so as not to be a burden on any of you.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:9] This was not because we had not a right to receive support, but our object was to give you a pattern for you to copy.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:10] Indeed, when we were with you, the rule we laid down was — ​‘Whoever does not choose to work will not get to eat.’
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:11] We hear that there are among you people who are living ill-ordered lives, and who, instead of attending to their own business, are mere busybodies.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:12] All such people we beg, and implore,, in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, to attend quietly to their business, and earn their own living.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:13] You, friends, must not grow weary of doing what is right.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:14] If anyone disregards what we have said in this letter, take note of them and avoid their company, so that they may feel ashamed.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:15] Yet do not think of them as an enemy, but caution them as you would a brother or sister.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:16] May the Lord, from whom all peace comes, himself give you his peace at all times and in all ways. May he be with you all.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:17] I, Paul, add this greeting in my own handwriting. It is my signature to every letter. This is how I write.
[OEBcw - 2Thess 3:18] May the blessing of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:1] From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the appointment of God, our Saviour, and Christ Jesus, our hope.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:2] To Timothy, my true child in the faith: May God, the Father, and Christ Jesus, our Lord, bless you, and be merciful to you, and give you peace.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:3] I beg you, as I did when I was on my way into Macedonia, to remain at Ephesus; that you may instruct certain people there not to teach new and strange doctrines,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:4] nor to devote their attention to legends and interminable genealogies, which tend to give rise to argument rather than to further that divine plan which is revealed in the faith.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:5] The object of all instruction is to call forth that love which comes from a pure heart, a clear conscience, and a sincere faith.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:6] And it is because they have not aimed at these things that the attention of certain people has been diverted to unprofitable subjects.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:7] They want to be teachers of the law, and yet do not understand either the words they use, or the subjects on which they speak so confidently.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:8] We know, of course, that the law is excellent, when used legitimately,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:9] by one who recognises that laws were not made for good people, but for the lawless and disorderly, for irreligious and wicked people, for those who are irreverent and profane, for those who ill-treat their fathers or mothers, for murderers,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:10] for the immoral, for perverts, for slave-dealers, for liars, for perjurers, and for whatever else is opposed to sound Christian teaching —
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:11] as is taught in the glorious good news of the ever-blessed God, with which I was entrusted.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:12] I am thankful to Christ Jesus, our Lord, who has been my strength, for showing that he thought me worthy of trust by appointing me to his ministry,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:13] though I once used to blaspheme, and to persecute, and to insult. Yet mercy was shown me, because I acted in ignorance, while still an unbeliever;
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:14] and the loving kindness of our Lord was boundless, and filled me with that faith and love which come from union with Christ Jesus.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:15] How true the saying is, and worthy of the fullest acceptance, that ‘Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners’! And there is no greater sinner than I!
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:16] Yet mercy was shown me for the express purpose that Christ Jesus might exhibit in my case, beyond all others, his exhaustless patience, as an example for those who were afterwards to believe on him and attain eternal life.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:17] To the eternal King, ever-living, invisible, the one God, be ascribed honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:18] This, then, is the charge that I lay on you, Timothy, my child, in accordance with what was predicted of you — Fight the good fight in the spirit of those predictions,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:19] with faith, and with a clear conscience; and it is because they have thrust this aside, that, as regards the faith, some have wrecked their lives.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 1:20] Hymenaeus and Alexander are instances — the men whom I delivered over to Satan so that they might be taught not to blaspheme.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:1] First of all, then, I ask that petitions, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings should be offered for everyone,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:2] especially for kings and all who are in high positions, in order that we may lead a quiet and peaceful life in a deeply religious and reverent spirit.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:3] This will be good and acceptable in the eyes of God, our Saviour,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:4] whose will is that everyone should be saved, and attain to a full knowledge of the truth.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:5] There is but one God, and one mediator between God and men — the man, Christ Jesus,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:6] who gave himself as a ransom on behalf of all men. This must be our testimony, as opportunities present themselves;
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:7] and it was for this that I was myself appointed a herald and an apostle (I am telling the simple truth and no lie) — a teacher of the Gentiles in the faith and truth.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:8] My desire, then, is that it should be the custom everywhere for the men to lead the prayers, with hands reverently uplifted, avoiding heated controversy.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:9] I also desire that women should adorn themselves with appropriate dress, worn quietly and modestly, and not with wreaths or gold ornaments for the hair, or pearls, or costly clothing,
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:10] but — as is proper for women who profess to be religious — with good actions.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:11] They must learn, listening quietly to their teachers and showing them all deference.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:12] I do not consent to them becoming teachers, or exercising authority over men; they ought to not make a fuss.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:13] Adam was formed first, not Eve.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:14] And it was not Adam who was deceived; it was the woman who was entirely deceived and fell into sin.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 2:15] But she will be saved by the birth of a child, if they never abandon faith, love, or holiness, and behave with modesty.
[OEBcw - 1Tim 3 - start]
