[OEBcw - Heb 12:28] Therefore, let us, who have received a kingdom that cannot be shaken, be thankful, and so offer acceptable worship to God, with awe and the deepest respect.
[OEBcw - Heb 12:29] For our God is ‘a consuming fire.’
[OEBcw - Heb 13 - start] 
[OEBcw - Heb 13:1] Let your love for the Lord's followers continue.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:2] Do not neglect to show hospitality; for, through being hospitable, people have all unawares entertained angels.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:3] Remember the prisoners, as if you were their fellow prisoners, and the oppressed, not forgetting that you also are still in the body.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:4] Let marriage be honoured by all and the married life be pure; for God will judge those who are immoral and those who commit adultery.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:5] Do not let your conduct be ruled by the love of money. Be content with what you have, for God himself has said — ‘I will never forsake you, nor will I ever abandon you.’
[OEBcw - Heb 13:6] Therefore we may say with confidence — ‘The Lord is my helper, I will not be afraid. What can mere people do to me?’
[OEBcw - Heb 13:7] Do not forget your leaders, who told you God’s message. Recall the close of their lives, and imitate their faith.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:8] Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today — yes, and for ever!
[OEBcw - Heb 13:9] Do not let yourselves be carried away by the various novel forms of teaching. It is better to rely for spiritual strength on the divine help, than on regulations regarding food; for those whose lives are guided by such regulations have not found them of service.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:10] We are not without an altar; but it is one at which those who still worship in the tent have no right to eat.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:11] The bodies of those animals whose blood is brought by the high priest into the sanctuary, as an offering for sin, are burnt outside the camp.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:12] And so Jesus, also, to purify the people by his own blood, suffered outside the gate.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:13] Therefore let us go out to him ‘outside the camp,’ bearing the same reproaches as he;
[OEBcw - Heb 13:14] for here we have no permanent city, but are looking for the city that is to be.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:15] Through him let us offer, as our sacrifice, continual praise to God — an offering from lips that glorify his name.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:16] Never forget to do kindly acts and to share what you have with others, for such sacrifices are acceptable to God.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:17] Obey your leaders, and submit to their control, for they are watching over your souls, since they will have to render an account, so that they may do it with joy, and not in sorrow. That would not be to your advantage.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:18] Pray for us, for we are sure that our consciences are clear, since our wish is to be occupied with what is good.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:19] And I the more earnestly ask for your prayers, so that I may be restored to you the sooner.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:20] May God, the source of all peace, who brought back from the dead him who, ‘by virtue of the blood that rendered valid the unchangeable covenant, is the great shepherd of God’s Sheep,’ Jesus, our Lord —
[OEBcw - Heb 13:21] may God make you perfect in everything that is good, so that you may be able to do his will. May he bring out in us all that is pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be all glory for ever and ever. Amen.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:22] I beg you, friends, to bear with these words of advice. For I have written only very briefly to you.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:23] You will be glad to hear that our friend, Timothy, has been set free. If he comes here soon, we will visit you together.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:24] Give our greeting to all your leaders, and to all Christ’s people. Our friends from Italy send their greetings to you.
[OEBcw - Heb 13:25] May God bless you all.
[OEBcw - Jas 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - Jas 1:1] James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, greets the twelve tribes that are living abroad.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:2] My friends, whatever may be the temptations that beset you from time to time, always regard them as a reason for rejoicing,
[OEBcw - Jas 1:3] knowing, as you do, that the testing of your faith develops endurance.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:4] And let endurance do its work perfectly, so that you may be altogether perfect, and in no respect deficient.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:5] If one of you is deficient in wisdom, let them ask wisdom from the God who gives freely to everyone without reproaches, and it will be given to them.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:6] But let them ask with confidence, never doubting; for the person who doubts is like a wave of the sea driven here and there at the mercy of the wind —
[OEBcw - Jas 1:7] Such a person must not expect that they will receive anything from the Lord,
[OEBcw - Jas 1:8] vacillating as they are, irresolute at every turn.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:9] Let a follower in humble circumstances be proud of their exalted position, but a rich follower of their humiliation;
[OEBcw - Jas 1:10] for the rich will pass away ‘like the flower of the grass.’
[OEBcw - Jas 1:11] As the sun rises, and the hot wind blows, ‘the grass withers, its flower fades,’ and all its beauty is gone. So is it with the rich . In the midst of their pursuits they will come to an untimely end.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:12] Blessed is the person who remains firm under temptation, for, when they have stood the test, they will receive the crown of life, which the Lord has promised to those who love him.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:13] Let no one say, when they are tempted, “It is God who is tempting me!” For God, who cannot be tempted to do wrong, does not himself tempt anyone.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:14] A person is in every case tempted by their own passions — allured and enticed by them.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:15] Then passion conceives and gives birth to sin, and sin, on reaching maturity, brings forth death.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:16] Do not be deceived, my dear friends.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:17] Every good thing given us, and every perfect gift, is from above, and comes down to us from the Maker of the lights in the heavens, who is himself never subject to change or to eclipse.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:18] Because he so willed, he gave us life, through the message of the truth, so that we should be, as it were, an earnest of still further creations.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:19] Mark this, my dear friends — Let everyone be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry;
[OEBcw - Jas 1:20] for human anger does not forward the righteous purpose of God.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:21] Therefore, have done with all filthiness and whatever wickedness still remains, and in a humble spirit receive that message which has been planted in your hearts and is able to save your souls.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:22] Put that message into practice, and do not merely listen to it — deceiving yourselves.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:23] For, when anyone listens to it and does not practice it, they like a person looking at their own face in a mirror.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:24] They look at themselves, then go on their way,
[OEBcw - Jas 1:25] but the person who looks carefully into the perfect law, the law of freedom, and continues to do so, not listening to it and then forgetting it, but putting it into practice — that person will be blessed in what they do.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:26] When a person appears to be religious, yet does not bridle their tongue, but imposes on their own conscience, that person’s religious observances are valueless.
[OEBcw - Jas 1:27] That religious observance which is pure and spotless in the eyes of God our Father is this — to visit orphans and widows in their trouble, and to keep oneself uncontaminated by the world.
[OEBcw - Jas 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - Jas 2:1] My friends, are you really trying to combine faith in Jesus Christ, our glorified Lord, with the worship of rank?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:2] Suppose a visitor should enter your Synagogue, with gold rings and in grand clothes, and suppose a poor man should come in also, in shabby clothes,
[OEBcw - Jas 2:3] and you are deferential to the visitor who is wearing grand clothes, and say — “There is a good seat for you here,” but to the poor man — “You must stand; or sit down there by my footstool,”
[OEBcw - Jas 2:4] Is not that to make distinctions among yourselves, and show yourselves prejudiced judges?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:5] Listen, my dear friends. Has not God chosen those who are poor in the things of this world to be rich through their faith, and to possess the kingdom which he has promised to those who love him?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:6] But you — you insult the poor man! Is not it the rich who oppress you? Is not it they who drag you into law courts?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:7] Is not it they who malign that honourable name which has been bestowed on you?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:8] Yet, if you keep the royal law which runs — ‘You must love your neighbour as you love yourself,’ you are doing right;
[OEBcw - Jas 2:9] but, if you worship rank, you commit a sin, and stand convicted by that same law of being offenders against it.
[OEBcw - Jas 2:10] For a person who has laid the law, as a whole, to heart, but has failed in one particular, is accountable for breaking all its provisions.
[OEBcw - Jas 2:11] He who said ‘You must not commit adultery’ also said ‘You must not murder.’ If, then, you commit murder but not adultery, you are still an offender against the law.
[OEBcw - Jas 2:12] Therefore, speak and act as people who are to be judged by the ‘law of freedom.’
[OEBcw - Jas 2:13] For there will be justice without mercy for the person who has not acted mercifully. Mercy triumphs over Justice.
[OEBcw - Jas 2:14] My friends, what is the good of a person’s saying that they have faith, if they do not prove it by actions? Can such faith save them?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:15] Suppose some brother or sister should be in need of clothes and of daily bread,
[OEBcw - Jas 2:16] and one of you were to say to them — “Go, and peace be with you; find warmth and food for yourselves,” and yet you were not to give them the necessaries of life, what good would it be to them?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:17] In just the same way faith, if not followed by actions, is, by itself, a lifeless thing.
[OEBcw - Jas 2:18] Some one, indeed, may say — “You are a man of faith, and I am a man of action.” “Then show me your faith,” I reply, “apart from any actions, and I will show you my faith by my actions.”
[OEBcw - Jas 2:19] It is a part of your faith, is it not, that there is one God? Good; yet even the demons have that faith, and tremble at the thought.
[OEBcw - Jas 2:20] Now do you really want to understand, fool, how it is that faith without actions leads to nothing?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:21] Look at our ancestor, Abraham. Was not it the result of his actions that he was pronounced righteous after he had offered his son, Isaac, on the altar?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:22] You see how, in his case, faith and actions went together; that his faith was perfected as the result of his actions;
[OEBcw - Jas 2:23] and that in this way the words of scripture came true — ​“Abraham believed God, and that was regarded by God as righteousness,” and “He was called the friend of God.”
[OEBcw - Jas 2:24] You see, then, that it is as the result of their actions that a person is pronounced righteous, and not of their faith only.
[OEBcw - Jas 2:25] Was not it the same with the prostitute, Rahab? Was not it as the result of her actions that she was pronounced righteous, after she had welcomed the messengers and helped them escape by?
[OEBcw - Jas 2:26] Exactly as a body is dead without a spirit, so faith is dead without actions.
[OEBcw - Jas 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - Jas 3:1] I do not want many of you, my friends, to become teachers, knowing, as you do, that we who teach will be judged by a more severe standard than others.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:2] We often make mistakes, every one of us. Anyone who does not make mistakes when speaking is indeed a perfect person, able to bridle their whole body as well.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:3] When we put bits into horses’ mouths, to make them obey us, we control the rest of their bodies so.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:4] Again, think of ships. Large as they are, and even when driven by fierce winds, they are controlled by a very small rudder and steered in whatever direction the man at the helm may determine.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:5] So is it with the tongue. Small as it is, it is a great boaster. Think how tiny a spark may set the largest forest ablaze!
[OEBcw - Jas 3:6] And the tongue is like a spark. Among the members of our body it proves itself a ​world of mischief; it contaminates the whole body; it sets the wheels of life on fire, and is itself set on fire by the flames of Gehenna.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:7] For while all sorts of beasts and birds, and of reptiles and creatures in the sea, are tameable, and actually have been tamed by man,
[OEBcw - Jas 3:8] no human being can tame the tongue. It is a restless plague! It is charged with deadly poison!
[OEBcw - Jas 3:9] With it we bless our Lord and Father, and with it we curse people who are made ‘in God’s likeness.’
[OEBcw - Jas 3:10] From the very same mouth come blessings and curses! My friends, it is not right that this should be so.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:11] Does a spring give both good and bad water from the same source?
[OEBcw - Jas 3:12] Can a fig tree, my friends, bear olives? Or a vine bear figs? No, nor can a brackish well give good water.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:13] Who among you claims to be wise and intelligent? Let them show that their actions are the outcome of a good life lived in the humility of true wisdom.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:14] But, while you harbour envy and bitterness and a spirit of rivalry in your hearts, do not boast or lie to the detriment of the truth.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:15] That is not the wisdom which comes from above; no, it is earthly, animal, devilish.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:16] For, where envy and rivalry exist, there you will also find disorder and all kinds of base actions.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:17] But the wisdom from above is, before every thing else, pure; then peace-loving, gentle, open to conviction, rich in compassion and good deeds, and free from partiality and insincerity.
[OEBcw - Jas 3:18] And righteousness, its fruit, is sown in peace by those who work for peace.
[OEBcw - Jas 4 - start] 
[OEBcw - Jas 4:1] What is the cause of the fighting and quarrelling that goes on among you? Is not it to be found in the desires which are always at war within you?
[OEBcw - Jas 4:2] You crave, yet do not obtain. You murder and rage, yet cannot gain your end. You quarrel and fight. You do not obtain, because you do not ask.
[OEBcw - Jas 4:3] You ask, yet do not receive, because you ask for a wrong purpose — to spend what you get on your pleasures.
[OEBcw - Jas 4:4] Unfaithful people! Do not you know that to be friends with the world means to be at enmity with God? Therefore whoever chooses to be friends with the world makes himself an enemy to God.
[OEBcw - Jas 4:5] Do you suppose there is no meaning in the passage of scripture which asks — ‘Is envy to result from the longings of the Spirit which God has implanted within you?’
[OEBcw - Jas 4:6] No; the gift that God gives is for a nobler end; and that is why it is said — ‘God is opposed to the haughty, but gives help to the humble.’
[OEBcw - Jas 4:7] Therefore submit to God; but resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
[OEBcw - Jas 4:8] Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Make your hands clean, you sinners; and your hearts pure, you vacillator!
[OEBcw - Jas 4:9] Grieve, mourn, and lament! Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your happiness to gloom!
[OEBcw - Jas 4:10] Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will exalt you.
[OEBcw - Jas 4:11] Do not disparage one another, friends. The person who disparages others, or passes judgment on them, disparages the law and passes judgment on the law. But, if you pass judgment on the law, you are not obeying it, but judging it.
[OEBcw - Jas 4:12] There is only one lawgiver and judge — he who has the power both to save and to destroy. But who are you that pass judgment on your neighbour?
[OEBcw - Jas 4:13] Listen to me, you who say ‘Today or tomorrow we will go to such and such a town, spend a year there, and trade, and make money,’
[OEBcw - Jas 4:14] And yet you do not know what your life will be like tomorrow! For you are but a mist appearing for a little while and then disappearing.
[OEBcw - Jas 4:15] You ought, rather, to say ‘If the Lord wills, we will live and do this or that.’
[OEBcw - Jas 4:16] But, as it is, you are constantly boasting presumptuously! All such boasting is wicked.
[OEBcw - Jas 4:17] The person, then, who knows what is right but fails to do it — that is sin in them.
[OEBcw - Jas 5 - start] 
[OEBcw - Jas 5:1] Listen to me, you rich people, weep and wail for the miseries that are coming upon you!
[OEBcw - Jas 5:2] Your riches have wasted away, and your clothes have become moth-eaten.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:3] Your gold and silver are rusted; and the rust on them will be evidence against you, and will eat into your ​flesh. It was fire, so to speak, that you stored up for yourselves in these last days.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:4] I tell you, the wages of the labourers who mowed your fields, which you have been fraudulently keeping back, are crying out against you, and the outcries of your reapers have reached the ears of the Lord of Hosts!
[OEBcw - Jas 5:5] You have lived on earth a life of extravagance and luxury; you have indulged your fancies in a time of bloodshed.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:6] You have condemned, you have murdered, the righteous one! Must not God be opposed to you?
[OEBcw - Jas 5:7] Be patient, then, friends, until the coming of the Lord. Even the farmer has to wait for the precious fruit of the earth, watching over it patiently, until it has had the spring and summer rains.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:8] And you must be patient also, and not be discouraged; for the Lord’s coming is near.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:9] Do not make complaints against one another, friends, or judgment will be passed on you. The judge is already standing at the door!
[OEBcw - Jas 5:10] Friends, as an example of the patient endurance of suffering, take the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:11] We count those who displayed such endurance blessed! You have heard, too, of Job’s endurance, and have seen what the Lord’s purpose was, for ‘the Lord is full of pity and compassion.’
[OEBcw - Jas 5:12] Above all things, my friends, never take an oath, either by heaven, or by earth, or by anything else. With you let ‘Yes’ suffice for yes, and ‘No’ for no, so that you may escape condemnation.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:13] If any of you is in trouble, let them pray; if anyone is happy, let them sing hymns.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:14] If anyone of you is ill, let him send for the officers of the church, and let them pray over them, after anointing them with oil in the name of the Lord.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:15] The prayer offered in faith will save the person who is sick, and the Lord will raise them from their bed; and if they have committed sins, they will be forgiven.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:16] Therefore, confess your sins to one another and pray for one another, so that you may be cured. Great is the power of a good person’s fervent prayer.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:17] Elijah was only human like ourselves, but, when he prayed fervently that it might not rain, no rain fell on the land for three years and a half.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:18] And, when he prayed again, the clouds brought rain, and the land bore crops.
[OEBcw - Jas 5:19] My friends, should one of you be led astray from the truth, and someone bring them back again,
[OEBcw - Jas 5:20] be sure that the person who brings a sinner back from their mistaken ways will save that person’s soul from death, and throw a veil over countless sins.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:1] To the people of God who are living abroad, dispersed throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Roman Asia, and Bithynia,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:2] and who were chosen in accordance with the foreknowledge of God the Father, through the consecration of the Spirit, to learn obedience, and to be purified by the sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ, from Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ. May blessing and peace be yours in ever increasing measure.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:3] Blessed is the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has, in his great mercy, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:4] given us the new life of undying hope, that promises an inheritance, imperishable, stainless, unfading, which has been reserved for you in heaven —
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:5] for you who, through faith, are being guarded by the power of God, awaiting a salvation that is ready to be revealed in the last days.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:6] At the thought of this you are full of exultation, though (if it has been necessary) you have suffered for the moment somewhat from various trials;
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:7] that the genuineness of your faith — a thing far more precious than gold, which is perishable, yet has to be tested by fire — may win praise and glory and honour at the appearing of Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:8] Though you have never seen him, yet you love him; though you do not even now see him, yet you believe in him, and exalt with a triumphant happiness too great for words,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:9] as you receive the reward of your faith in the salvation of your souls!
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:10] It was this salvation that the prophets, who spoke long ago of the blessing intended for you, sought, and strove to comprehend;
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:11] as they strove to discern what that time could be, to which the Spirit of Christ within them was pointing, when foretelling the sufferings that Christ would have to endure, and the glories that would follow.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:12] And it was revealed to them that it was not for themselves, but for you, that they were acting as Ministers of the truths which have now been told to you, by those who, with the help of the Holy Spirit sent from heaven, have brought you the good news — truths into which even angels long to look.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:13] Therefore concentrate your minds, with the strictest self-control, and fix your hopes on the blessing that is coming for you at the appearing of Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:14] Be like obedient children; do not let your lives be shaped by the passions which once swayed you in the days of your ignorance,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:15] but in your whole life show yourselves to be holy, after the pattern of the Holy One from whom you received your call.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:16] For scripture says — ‘You will be holy, because I am holy.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:17] And since you call on him as ‘Father,’ who judges everyone impartially by what he has done, let respectful awe be the spirit of your lives during the time of your stay on earth.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:18] For you know that it was not by perishable things, such as silver and gold, that you were ransomed from the aimless way of living which was handed down to you from your ancestors,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:19] but by precious blood, as it were of a lamb, unblemished and spotless, the blood of Christ.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:20] Destined for this before the beginning of the world, he has been revealed in these last days for your sakes,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:21] who, through him, are faithful to God who raised him from the dead and gave him honour, so that your faith and hope are now in God.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:22] Now that, by your obedience to the truth, you have purified your lives, so that there is growing up among you a genuine affection, love one another earnestly with all your hearts;
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:23] since your new life has come, not from perishable, but imperishable, seed, through the message of the Everliving God.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:24] For — ‘All earthly life is but as grass, and all its splendour as the flower of grass. The grass fades, its flower falls,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 1:25] but the teaching of the Lord remains for ever.’ And that is the teaching of the good news which has been told to you.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:1] Now that you have done with all malice, all deceitfulness, insincerity, jealous feelings, and all backbiting,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:2] like newly born infants, crave pure spiritual milk, so that you may be enabled by it to grow until you attain salvation —
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:3] since ‘you have found by experience that the Lord is kind.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:4] Come to him, then, as to a living stone, rejected, indeed, by men, but in God’s eyes choice and precious;
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:5] and, as living stones, form yourselves into a spiritual house, to be a consecrated priesthood, for the offering of spiritual sacrifices that will be acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:6] For there is a passage of scripture that runs — ‘See, I am placing in Zion a choice and precious corner-stone; And those who believe in him will have no cause for shame.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:7] It is to you, then, who believe in him that he is precious, but to those who do not believe he is ‘a stone which, though rejected by the builders, has now itself become the corner-stone,’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:8] and ‘a stumbling-block, and a rock which will prove a hindrance.’ They stumble because they do not accept the message. This was the fate destined for them.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:9] But you are ‘a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a consecrated nation, God’s own people,’ entrusted with the proclamation of the goodness of him who called you out of darkness into his wonderful light.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:10] Once you were ‘not a people,’ but now you are ‘God’s people’; once you ‘had not found mercy,’ but now you ‘have found mercy.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:11] Dear friends, I beg you, as pilgrims and strangers on earth, to refrain from indulging the cravings of your earthly nature, for they make war on the soul.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:12] Let your daily life among the Gentiles be so upright, that, whenever they malign you as evil-doers, they may learn, as they watch, from the uprightness of your conduct, to praise God ‘at the time when he will visit them.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:13] Submit to all human institutions for the Lord’s sake, alike to the emperor as the supreme authority,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:14] and to governors as sent by him to punish evil-doers and to commend those who do right.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:15] For God’s will is this — that you should silence the ignorance of foolish people by doing what is right.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:16] Act as free people, yet not using your freedom as those do who make it a cloak for wickedness, but as Servants of God.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:17] Show honour to everyone, love the Lord's followers, ‘revere God, honour the emperor.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:18] Those of you who are domestic servants should always be submissive and respectful to their masters, not only to those who are good and considerate, but also to those who are arbitrary.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:19] For this wins God’s approval when, because conscious of God’s presence, a person who is suffering unjustly bears their troubles patiently.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:20] What credit can you claim when, after doing wrong, you take your punishment for it patiently? But, on the other hand, if, after doing right, you take your sufferings patiently, that does win the approval of God.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:21] For it was to this that you were called! For Christ, too, suffered — on your behalf — and left you an example, that you should follow in his steps.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:22] He ‘never sinned, nor was anything deceitful ever heard from his lips.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:23] He was abused, but he did not answer with abuse; he suffered, but he did not threaten; he entrusted himself to him whose judgments are just.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:24] And he ‘himself carried our sins’ in his own body to the cross, so that we might die to our sins, and live for righteousness. ‘His bruising was your healing.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 2:25] Once you were straying like sheep, but now you have returned to the shepherd and guardian of your souls.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:1] Again, you married women should submit to your husbands, so that if any of them reject the message, they may, apart from the message, be won over, by the conduct of their wives,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:2] as they watch your submissive and blameless conduct.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:3] Yours should be, not the external adornment of the arrangement of the hair, the wearing of jewellery, or the putting on of dresses,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:4] but the inner life with the imperishable beauty of a quiet and gentle spirit; for this is very precious in God’s sight.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:5] It was by this that the holy women of old, who rested their hopes on God, adorned themselves; submitting to their husbands,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:6] as Sarah did, who obeyed Abraham, and called him master. And you are her true children, as long as you live good lives, and let nothing terrify you.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:7] Again, those of you who are married men should live considerately with their wives, showing due regard to their sex, as physically weaker than their own, and not forgetting that they share with you in the gift of life. Then you will be able to pray without hindrance.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:8] Lastly, you should all be united, sympathetic, full of love for each other, kind-hearted, humble-minded;
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:9] never returning evil for evil, or abuse for abuse, but, on the contrary, blessing. It was to this that you were called — to obtain a blessing!
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:10] ‘The person who wants to enjoy life And see happy days — Let them keep their tongue from evil And their lips from deceitful words,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:11] let them turn from evil and do good, Let them seek for peace and follow after it;
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:12] For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous, And his ears are attentive to their prayers, But the face of the Lord is set against those who do wrong.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:13] Who, indeed, is there to harm you, if you prove yourselves to be eager for what is good?
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:14] Even if you should suffer for righteousness, count yourselves blessed! ‘Do not let people terrify you, or allow yourselves to be dismayed.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:15] Revere the Christ as Lord in your hearts; always ready to give an answer to anyone who asks your reason for the hope that you cherish, but giving it with courtesy and respect,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:16] and keeping your consciences clear, so that, whenever you are maligned, those who vilify your good and Christian conduct may be put to shame.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:17] It is better that you should suffer, if that should be God’s will, for doing right, than for doing wrong.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:18] For Christ himself died to atone for sins once for all — the good on behalf of the bad — that he might bring you to God; his body being put to death, but his spirit entering on new life.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:19] And it was then that he went and preached to the imprisoned spirits,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:20] who once were disobedient, at the time when God patiently waited, in the days of Noah, while the ark was being prepared; in which some few lives, eight in all, were saved by means of water.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:21] And baptism, which this foreshadowed, now saves you — not the mere cleansing of the body, but the search of a clear conscience after God — through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 3:22] who has gone into heaven, and is at God’s right hand, where angels and archangels and the powers of heaven now yield submission to him.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:1] Since, then, Christ suffered in body, arm yourselves with the same resolve as he; for he who has suffered in body has ceased to sin,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:2] and so will live the rest of his earthly life guided, not by human passions, but by the will of God.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:3] Surely in the past you have spent time enough living as the Gentiles delight to live. For your path has lain among scenes of debauchery, licentiousness, drunkenness, revelry, hard-drinking, and profane idolatry.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:4] And, because you do not run to the same extremes of profligacy as others, they are astonished, and malign you.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:5] But they will have to answer for their conduct to him who is ready to judge both the living and the dead.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:6] For that was why the good news was told to the dead also — that, after they have been judged in the body, as people are judged, they might live in the spirit, as God lives.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:7] But the end of all things is near. Therefore exercise self-restraint and be calm, so that you may be able to pray.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:8] Above all things, let your love for one another be earnest, for ‘love throws a veil over countless sins.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:9] Never grudge hospitality to one another.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:10] Whatever the gift that each has received, use it in the service of others, as good stewards of the varied bounty of God.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:11] When anyone speaks, let them speak as one who is delivering the oracles of God. When anyone is endeavouring to serve others, let them do so in reliance on the strength which God supplies; so that in everything God may be honour ed through Jesus Christ — to whom be ascribed all honour and might for ever and ever. Amen.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:12] Dear friends, do not be astonished at the trial of fire that you are passing through, to test you, as though something strange were happening to you.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:13] No, the more you share the sufferings of the Christ, the more may you rejoice, that, when the time comes for the manifestation of his glory, you may rejoice and exult.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:14] If you are insulted for bearing the name of Christ, count yourselves blessed; because the divine glory and the Spirit of God are resting on you.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:15] I need hardly say that no one among you must suffer as a murderer, or a thief, or a criminal, or for interfering in matters which do not concern Christians.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:16] But, if someone suffers as a Christian, do not let them be ashamed of it; let them bring honour to God even though they bear that name.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:17] For the time has come for judgment to begin with the house of God; and, if it begins with us, what will be the end of those who reject God’s good news?
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:18] If ‘a good person is saved only with difficulty, what will become of the godless and the sinful?’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 4:19] Therefore, I say, let those who suffer, because God wills it so, commit their lives into the hands of a faithful Creator, and persevere in doing right.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:1] As for the older ones among you, who bear office in the church, I, their fellow officer, and a witness to the sufferings of the Christ, who will also share in the glory that is to be revealed —
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:2] I beg you to be true shepherds of the flock of God among you, not because you are compelled, but of your own free will; not from a base love of gain, but with a ready spirit;
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:3] not as lords of your charges, but as examples to your flock.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:4] Then, when the chief shepherd appears, you will win the crown of glory that never fades.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:5] Again, you younger ones should show deference to the older. And all of you should put on the badge of humility in mutual service, for ‘God is opposed to the proud, but gives his help to the humble.’
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:6] Humble yourselves, therefore, under the mighty hand of God, so that he may exalt you in his good time,
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:7] laying all your anxieties on him, for he makes you his care.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:8] Exercise self-control, be watchful. Your adversary, the devil, like a roaring lion, is prowling about, eager to devour you.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:9] Stand firm against him, strong in your faith; knowing, as you do, that the ​sufferings which you are undergoing are being endured to the full by the Lord's followers throughout the world.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:10] God, from whom all help comes, and who called you, by your union with Christ, into his eternal glory, will, when you have suffered for a little while, himself perfect, establish, strengthen you.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:11] To him be ascribed dominion for ever. Amen.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:12] I have been writing to you briefly by the hand of Silas, our true-hearted friend (for so I regard him), to encourage you, and to bear my testimony that in what I have written is to be found the true love of God. On that take your stand.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:13] Your sister church in ‘Babylon’ sends you greeting, and so does Mark, who is as a son to me.
[OEBcw - 1Pet 5:14] Greet one another with the kiss of love. May God give his peace to you all in your union with Christ.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:1] To those to whom, through the justice of our God and Saviour Jesus Christ, there has been granted faith equally privileged with our own, from Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:2] May blessing and peace be yours in ever increasing measure, as you advance in the knowledge of God and of Jesus, our Lord.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:3] For his divine power has given us everything that is needful for a life of piety, as we advance in the knowledge of him who called us by a glorious manifestation of his goodness.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:4] For it was through this that he gave us what we prize as the greatest of his promises, that through them you might participate in the divine nature, now that you have fled from the corruption in the world, resulting from human passions.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:5] Yes, and for this ​reason do your best to supplement your faith by goodness, goodness by knowledge,
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:6] knowledge by self-control, self-control by endurance, endurance by piety,
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:7] piety by mutual affection, and mutual affection by love.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:8] For, when these virtues are yours, in increasing measure, they prevent your being indifferent to, or destitute of, a fuller knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:9] Surely the person who has not these virtues is shortsighted even to blindness, and has chosen to forget that they have been purified from their sins of the past!
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:10] Therefore, friends, do your best to put God’s call and selection of you beyond all doubt; for, if you do this, you will never fall.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:11] For in this way you will be given a triumphant admission into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Saviour, Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:12] I will, therefore, always be ready to remind you of all this, even though you know it and are firmly established in the truth that you now hold.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:13] But I think it my duty, as long as I live in this ‘tent,’ to rouse you by awakening memories of the past;
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:14] for I know that the time for this ‘tent’ of mine to be put away is soon coming, as our Lord Jesus Christ himself assured me.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:15] So I will do my best to enable you, at any time after my departure, to call these truths to mind.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:16] For we were not following cleverly devised stories when we told you of the coming in power of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we had been eye-witnesses of his majesty.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:17] For he received honour and glory from God the Father, when from the glory of the Divine Majesty there were borne to his ears words such as these — ​‘This is my dearly loved son, who brings me great joy.’
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:18] These were the words that we heard, borne to our ears from heaven, when we were with him on that sacred mountain.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:19] And still stronger is the assurance that we have in the teaching of the prophets; to which you will do well to pay attention (as if it were a lamp shining in a gloomy place), until the day dawns and the morning star rises in your hearts.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:20] But first be assured of this: — There is no prophetic teaching found in scripture that can be interpreted by a person’s unaided reason;
[OEBcw - 2Pet 1:21] for no prophetic teaching ever came in the old days at the mere wish of people, but people, moved by the Holy Spirit, spoke direct from God.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:1] But there were false prophets also in the nation, just as there will be false teachers among you, people who will secretly introduce ruinous divisions, disowning even the Lord who bought them, and bringing speedy ruin on themselves.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:2] There will be many, too, who will follow their licentious courses, and cause the way of the truth to be maligned.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:3] In their covetousness they will try to make you a source of profit by their fabrications; but for a long time past their sentence has not been standing idle, nor their ruin slumbering.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:4] Remember, God did not spare angels when they sinned, but sent them down to Tartarus, and committed them to caverns of darkness, to be kept under guard for judgment.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:5] Nor did he spare the world of old; though he preserved Noah, the preacher of righteousness, and seven others, when he brought a flood on the godless world.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:6] He condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah and reduced them to ashes, holding them up as a warning to the godless of what was in store for them;
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:7] but he rescued righteous Lot, whose heart was vexed by the wanton licentiousness of his neighbours;
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:8] for, seeing and hearing what he did, as he lived his righteous life among them, day after day, Lot’s righteous soul was tortured by their wicked doings.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:9] The Lord, therefore, knows how to deliver the pious from temptation, and to keep the wicked, who are even now suffering punishment, in readiness for ‘the day of judgment’ —
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:10] especially those who, following the promptings of their lower nature, indulge their polluting passions and despise all control. Audacious and self-willed, they feel no awe of the celestial beings, maligning them,
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:11] even where angels, though excelling them in strength and power, do not bring against them a malignant charge before the Lord.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:12] These people, however, like animals without reason, intended by nature to be caught and killed — these people, I say, malign those of whom they know nothing, and will assuredly perish through their own corruption,
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:13] suffering themselves, as the penalty for the suffering that they have inflicted. They think that pleasure consists in the self-indulgence of the moment. They are a stain and a disgrace, indulging, as they do, in their wanton revelry, even while joining you at your feasts.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:14] They have eyes only for adulteresses, eyes never tired of sin; they entice weak souls; their minds are trained to covet; they live under a curse.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:15] Leaving the straight road, they have gone astray and followed in the steps of Balaam, the son of Beor, who set his heart on the reward for wrong-doing,
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:16] but was rebuked for his offence. A dumb animal spoke with a human voice, and checked the prophet’s madness.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:17] These people are like springs without water, or mists driven before a gale; and for them the blackest darkness has been reserved.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:18] With boastful and foolish talk, they appeal to the passions of people’s lower nature, and, by their profligacy, entice those who are just escaping from the people who live such misguided lives.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:19] They promise them freedom, while they themselves are slaves to corrupt habits; for a person is the slave of anything to which they give way.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:20] If, after having escaped the polluting influences of the world, through knowing our Lord and Saviour, Jesus Christ, people are again entangled in them, and give way to them, their last state has become worse than their first.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:21] It would, indeed, have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than, after knowing it, to turn away from the holy command delivered to them.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 2:22] In their case is seen the truth of the proverb — ​‘A dog returns to what it has vomited’ and ‘A sow after washing to her wallowing-place in the mud.’
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:1] This, dear friends, is my second letter to you. In both of them I have tried, by appealing to your remembrance, to arouse your better feelings.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:2] I want you to recall what was foretold by the holy prophets, as well as the command of our Lord and Saviour given to you through your apostles.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:3] First be assured of this, that, as the age draws to an end, scoffers, led by their own passions,
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:4] will come and ask scoffingly — ​‘Where is his promised coming? Ever since our ancestors passed to their rest, everything remains just as it was when the world was first created!’
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:5] For they wilfully shut their eyes to the fact that long ago the heavens existed; and the earth, also — formed out of water and by the action of water, by the fiat of God;
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:6] and that by the same means the world which then existed was destroyed in a deluge of water.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:7] But the present heavens and earth, by the same fiat, have been reserved for fire, and are being kept for the day of the judgment and destruction of the godless.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:8] But you, dear friends, must never shut your eyes to the fact that, to the Lord, one day is the same as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:9] The Lord is not slow to fulfil his promise, as some count slowness; but he is forbearing with you, as it is not his will that any of you should perish, but that all should be brought to repentance.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:10] The day of the Lord will come like a thief; and on that day the heavens will pass away with a crash, the elements will be burnt up and dissolved, and the earth and all that is in it will be disclosed.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:11] Now, since all these things are in the process of dissolution, think what you yourselves ought to be — what holy and pious lives you ought to lead,
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:12] while you wait for the coming of the day of God and strive to make it come soon. At its coming the heavens will be dissolved in fire, and the elements melted by heat,
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:13] but we look for ‘new heavens and a new earth,’ where righteousness will have its home, in fulfilment of the promise of God.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:14] Therefore, dear friends, in expectation of these things, make every effort to be found by him spotless, blameless, and at peace.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:15] Regard our Lord’s forbearance as your one hope of salvation. This is what our dear friend Paul wrote to you, with the wisdom that God gave him.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:16] It is the same in all his letters, when he speaks in them about these subjects. There are some things in them difficult to understand, which untaught and weak people distort, just as they do all other writings, to their own ruin.
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:17] You must, therefore, dear friends, now that you know this beforehand, be on your guard against being led away by the errors of reckless people, and so lapsing from your present steadfastness;
[OEBcw - 2Pet 3:18] and advance in the love and knowledge of our Lord and Saviour, Jesus Christ. All glory be to him now and for ever.
[OEBcw - 1John 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1John 1:1] It is of what has been in existence from the beginning, of what we have heard, of what we have seen with our eyes, of what we watched reverently and touched with our hands — it is about the Word who is the life that we are now writing.
[OEBcw - 1John 1:2] That life was made visible, and we have seen it, and now bear our testimony to it, and tell you of that eternal life, which was with the Father and was made visible to us.
[OEBcw - 1John 1:3] It is of what we have seen and heard that we now tell you, so that you may have communion with us. And our communion is with the Father and with his Son, Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - 1John 1:4] And we are writing all this to you that our joy may be complete.
[OEBcw - 1John 1:5] These, then, are the tidings that we have heard from him and now tell you — ​‘God is light, and darkness has no place at all in him.’
[OEBcw - 1John 1:6] If we say that we have communion with him, and yet continue to live in the darkness, we lie, and are not living the truth.
[OEBcw - 1John 1:7] But, if our lives are lived in the light, as God himself is in the light, we have communion with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.
[OEBcw - 1John 1:8] If we say that there is no sin in us, we are deceiving ourselves, and the truth has no place in us.
[OEBcw - 1John 1:9] If we confess our sins, God may be trusted, in his righteousness, to forgive us our sins and purify us from all wickedness.
[OEBcw - 1John 1:10] If we say that we have not sinned, we are making God a liar, and his message has no place in us.
[OEBcw - 1John 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1John 2:1] My children, I am writing to you to keep you from sinning; but if anyone should sin, we have one who can plead for us with the Father — Jesus Christ, the righteous —
[OEBcw - 1John 2:2] and he is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not for ours only, but for those of the whole world besides.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:3] And by this we know that we have learned to know him — by our laying his commands to heart.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:4] The person who says ‘I know Jesus,’ but does not lay his commands to heart, is a liar, and the truth has no place in them;
[OEBcw - 1John 2:5] but, whenever a person lays his message to heart, in that person the love of God has indeed reached its perfection. By this we know that we are in union with God —
[OEBcw - 1John 2:6] He who professes to maintain union with God is himself bound to live as Christ lived.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:7] Dear friends, it is no new command that I am writing to you, but an old command, which you have had from the first. That old command is the message to which you listened.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:8] Yet, in a way, it is a new command that I am writing to you — ​manifest in Christ’s life and in your own — for the darkness is passing away and the true light is already shining.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:9] The person who says that they are in the light, and yet hates others, is in the darkness even now.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:10] The person who loves others is always in the light, and there is nothing within them to cause them to stumble;
[OEBcw - 1John 2:11] while the person who hates others is in the darkness, and is living in the darkness, and does not know where they are going, because the darkness prevents them seeing.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:12] I am writing, God's children, to you, because your sins have been forgiven you for Christ’s sake.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:13] I am writing, adults in the faith, to you, because you have learned to know him who has been from the beginning. I am writing, young ones in the faith, to you, because you have conquered the evil one. I write, children, to you, because you have learned to know the Father.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:14] I write, adults in the faith, to you, because you have learned to know him who has been from the beginning. I write, young ones in the faith, to you, because you are strong, and God’s message is always in your hearts, and you have conquered the evil one.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:15] Do not love the world or what the world can offer. When anyone loves the world, there is no love for the Father in them;
[OEBcw - 1John 2:16] for all that the world can offer — the gratification of the earthly nature, the gratification of the eye, the pretentious life — belongs, not to the Father, but to the world.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:17] And the world, and all that it gratifies, is passing away, but they who do God’s will remains for ever.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:18] My children, these are the last days. You were told that an antichrist was coming; and many antichrists have already arisen. By that we know that these are the last days.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:19] From us, it is true, they went out, but they had never belonged to us; for, if they had belonged to us, they would have remained among us. They left us that it might be made clear that they do not, any of them, belong to us.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:20] You, however, have received consecration from the Holy One.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:21] You all know — But I am not writing to you because you do not know the truth, but because you do know it, and because nothing false can come from the truth.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:22] Who is a liar, if not the person who rejects the truth that Jesus is the Christ? That person is the antichrist — the person who rejects the Father and the Son.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:23] No one who rejects the Son has found the Father; the person who acknowledges the Son has found the Father also.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:24] As for you, let what you were told at the first be always in your thoughts. If, then, what you were told at the first is always in your thoughts, you yourselves will maintain your union both with the Son and with the Father.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:25] And this is what he himself promised us — eternal life!
[OEBcw - 1John 2:26] In writing this this to you, I have in mind those who are trying to mislead you.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:27] But you — you still retain in your hearts that consecration which you received from the Christ, and are not in need of anyone to teach you; but, since his consecration of you teaches you about everything, and since it is a real consecration, and no lie, then, as it has taught you, maintain your union with him.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:28] Yes, my children, maintain your union with Christ, so that, whenever he appears, our confidence may not fail us, and we may not be ashamed to meet him at his coming.
[OEBcw - 1John 2:29] Knowing him to be righteous, you realise that everyone who lives righteously has received the new life from him.
[OEBcw - 1John 3 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1John 3:1] Think what love the Father has shown us in allowing us to be called ‘children of God’; as indeed we are. The reason why the world does not know us is that it has not learned to know him.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:2] Dear friends, we are God’s children now; what we will be has not yet been revealed. What we do know is that, when it is revealed, we will be like Christ; because we will see him as he is.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:3] And everyone who has this hope with regard to Christ tries to make themselves pure — as Christ is pure.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:4] Everyone who lives sinfully is living in violation of law. Sin is violation of law.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:5] And you know that Christ appeared to take away our sins; and in him sin has no place.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:6] No one who maintains union with him lives in sin; no one who lives in sin has ever really seen him or learned to know him.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:7] My children, do not let anyone mislead you. The person who lives righteously is righteous — as Christ is righteous.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:8] The person who lives sinfully belongs to the devil, for the devil has sinned from the first. It was for this that the Son of God appeared, that he might undo the devil’s work.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:9] No one who has received the new life from God lives sinfully, because the ​nature of God dwells within them; and they cannot live in sin, because they have received the new life from God.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:10] By this the children of God are distinguished from the children of the devil — No one who lives unrighteously comes from God, and especially the person who does not love others.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:11] For these are the tidings that we heard from the first — that we are to love one another.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:12] We must not be like Cain, who belonged to the evil one and killed his brother. And why did he kill him? It was because his life was bad while his brother’s was good.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:13] Do not wonder, friends, if the world hates you.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:14] We know that we have passed out of death into life, because we love each other. The person who does not love remains in a state of death.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:15] The person who hates another is a murderer; and you know that no murderer has eternal life within them.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:16] We have learned to know what love is from this — that Christ laid down his life on our behalf. Therefore we also ought to lay down our lives for each other.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:17] But, if anyone has worldly possessions, and yet looks on while one of our own is in need, and steels their heart against that person, how can it be said that the love of God is within them?
[OEBcw - 1John 3:18] My children, do not let our love be mere words, or end in talk; let it be true and show itself in acts.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:19] By that we will know that we are on the side of the truth; and we will satisfy ourselves in God’s sight,
[OEBcw - 1John 3:20] that if our conscience condemns us, yet God is greater than our conscience and knows everything.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:21] Dear friends, if our conscience does not condemn us, then we approach God with confidence,
[OEBcw - 1John 3:22] and we receive from him whatever we ask, because we are laying his commands to heart, and are doing what is pleasing in his sight.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:23] His command is this — that we should put our trust in the name of his Son, Jesus Christ, and love one another, in accordance with the command that he gave us.
[OEBcw - 1John 3:24] And the person who lays his commands to heart maintains union with Christ, and Christ with them. And by this we know that Christ maintains union with us — by our possession of the Spirit which he gave us.
[OEBcw - 1John 4 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1John 4:1] Dear friends, do not trust every inspiration, but test each inspiration, to see whether it proceeds from God; because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:2] This is the way by which to know the inspiration of God — All inspiration that acknowledges Jesus Christ as come in our human nature is from God;
[OEBcw - 1John 4:3] while all inspiration that does not acknowledge Jesus is not inspiration from God. It is the inspiration of the Antichrist; you have heard that it was to come, and it is now already in the world.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:4] You, my children, come from God, and you have successfully resisted such people as these, because he who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:5] Those people belong to the world; and therefore they speak as the world speaks, and the world listens to them.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:6] We come from God. He who knows God listens to us; the person who does not come from God does not listen to us. By that we may know the true inspiration from the false.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:7] Dear friends, let us love one another, because love comes from God; and everyone who loves has received the new life from God and knows God.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:8] The person who does not love has not learned to know God; for God is love.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:9] The love of God was revealed to us by his sending his only Son into the world, so that we might find life through him.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:10] His love is seen in this — not in our having loved God, but in his loving us and sending his Son to be an atoning sacrifice for our sins.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:11] Dear friends, since God loved us in this way, we, surely, ought to love one another.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:12] No human eyes have ever seen God, yet, if we love one another, God remains in union with us, and his love attains its perfection in us.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:13] We know that we remain in union with him, and he with us, by this — by his having given us some measure of his Spirit.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:14] Moreover, our eyes have seen — and we are testifying to the fact — that the Father has sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:15] Whoever acknowledges that Jesus Christ is the Son of God — God remains in union with that man, and he with God.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:16] And, moreover, we have learned to know, and have accepted as a fact, the love which God has for us. God is love; and whoever lives in love lives in God, and God in them.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:17] It is through this that love has attained its perfection in us, so that we may have confidence on the day of judgment, because what Christ is that we also are in this world.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:18] There is no fear in love. No! Love, when perfect, drives out fear, because fear implies punishment, and the person who feels fear has not attained to perfect love.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:19] We love, because God first loved us.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:20] If someone says ‘I love God,’ and yet hates another person, they are a liar; for the person who does not love their fellow, whom they have seen, cannot love God, whom they have not seen.
[OEBcw - 1John 4:21] Indeed, we have this command from God — ​‘Those who love God must also love each other.’
[OEBcw - 1John 5 - start] 
[OEBcw - 1John 5:1] Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ has received the new life from God; and everyone who loves him who gave that life loves him who has received it.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:2] By this we know that we love God’s children — when we love God and carry out his commands.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:3] For to love God is to lay his commands to heart; and his commands are not burdensome,
[OEBcw - 1John 5:4] because all that has received the new life from God conquers the world. And this is the power that has conquered the world — our faith!
[OEBcw - 1John 5:5] Who is the person that conquers the world but the person who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
[OEBcw - 1John 5:6] He it is whose coming was by water and blood — Jesus Christ himself; not by water only, but by water and by blood. And there is the Spirit also to bear testimony, and the Spirit is truth itself.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:7] It is a threefold testimony —
[OEBcw - 1John 5:8] that of the Spirit, the water, and the blood — and these three are at one.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:9] We accept the testimony of people, but God’s testimony is still stronger; and there is the testimony of God — the fact that he has already borne testimony about his Son.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:10] The person who believes in the Son of God has that testimony within them. The person who does not believe God has made God a liar, by refusing to believe in that testimony which he has borne about his Son.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:11] And that testimony is that God gave us eternal life, and that this life is in his Son.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:12] The person who finds the Son finds life; the person who does not find the Son of God does not find life.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:13] I write this to you so that you may realise that you have found eternal life — you who believe in the name of the Son of God.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:14] And this is the confidence with which we approach him, that whenever we ask anything that is in accordance with his will, he listens to us.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:15] And if we realise that he listens to us — whatever we ask — we realise that we have what we have asked from him.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:16] If anyone sees one of our people committing some sin that is not a deadly sin, they will ask, and so be the means of giving life to them — to any whose sin is not deadly. There is such a thing as deadly sin; about that I do not say that a person should pray.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:17] Every wrong action is sin, and there is sin that is not deadly.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:18] We know that no one who has received the new life from God lives in sin. No, the person who has received the new life from God keeps the thought of God in their heart, and then the evil one does not touch them.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:19] We realise that we come from God, while all the world is under the influence of the evil one.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:20] We realise, too, that the Son of God has come among us, and has given us the discernment to know the true God; and we are in union with the true God by our union with his Son, Jesus Christ. He is the true God and he is eternal life.
[OEBcw - 1John 5:21] My children, guard yourselves against false ideas of God.
[OEBcw - 2John 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - 2John 1:1]  To an eminent Christian Lady, and to her children, from the officer of the church. I sincerely love you all, and not I only, but also all those who have learned to know the truth.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:2] We love you for the sake of that truth which is always in our hearts; yes, and it will be ours for ever.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:3] Blessing, mercy, and peace will be ours — the gift of God, the Father, and of Jesus Christ, the Father’s Son — in a life of truth and love.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:4] It was a great joy to me to find the lives of some of your children guided by the truth, in obedience to the command that we received from the Father.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:5] And now, I pray you, Lady — not as though I were writing a new command for you; no, it is the command which we had from the first — Let us love one another.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:6] And this is love — to live in obedience to the Father’s commands. This is the command as you learned from the first, to live in a spirit of love.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:7] I say this because many impostors have left us to go into the world — people who do not acknowledge Jesus as Christ come in our human nature. It is that which marks someone as an impostor and an antichrist.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:8] Take care that you do not lose the fruit of all our work; rather, reap the benefit of it in full.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:9] Everyone who goes beyond the limits of the teaching of the Christ has failed to find God; the person who keeps to that teaching — they have found both the Father and the Son.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:10] If anyone comes to you and does not bring this teaching, do not receive them into your house or welcome them;
[OEBcw - 2John 1:11] for the person who welcomes them is sharing with them in his wicked work.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:12] Though I have a great deal to say to you, I would rather not trust it to paper and ink, but I am hoping to come and see you, and to speak with you face to face, so that your joy may be complete.
[OEBcw - 2John 1:13] The children of your eminent sister send you their greetings.
[OEBcw - 3John 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - 3John 1:1]  To his dear friend Gaius, whom he sincerely loves, From the officer of the church.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:2] Dear friend, I pray that all may be well with you and that you may have good health — I know that all is well with your soul.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:3] For it was a great joy to me, when some followers of the Lord came and testified to your fidelity to the truth — I know that your own life is guided by the truth.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:4] Nothing gives me greater pleasure than to hear from time to time that the lives of my children are guided by the truth.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:5] Dear friend, whatever you do for other followers is done in a Christian spirit — even when they are strangers to you.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:6] They themselves have testified before the church to your love; and you will do well to help them on their way in a manner worthy of the service of God.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:7] For it was on behalf of the name that they left their homes, and refused to take anything from the Gentiles.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:8] We, therefore, ought to give such people a hearty welcome, and so take our share in their work for the truth.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:9] I wrote a few lines to the church; but Diotrephes, who loves to be first among them, declines to recognise us.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:10] Therefore, when I come, I will not forget his conduct in ridiculing us with his wicked tongue. Not content with that, he not only declines to recognise our friends who are followers himself, but actually prevents those who would, and expels them from the church.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:11] Dear friend, take what is good for your example, not what is bad. The person who does what is good is from God; the person who does what is bad has never seen God.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:12] Everyone has always had a good word for Demetrius, and the truth itself speaks for him. Yes, and we also add our good word, and you know that what we say about him is true.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:13] I have a great deal to say to you, but I do not care to trust it to pen and ink in a letter.
[OEBcw - 3John 1:14] I hope, however, it will not be long before I see you, and then we will speak face to face. Peace be with you. Our friends here send you their greetings. Greet each one of our friends.
[OEBcw - Jude 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - Jude 1:1] To those who, having received the call, have been loved by God the Father and protected by Jesus Christ, From Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ, and the brother of James.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:2] May mercy, peace, and love be yours in ever increasing measure.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:3] Dear friends, while I was making every effort to write to you about our common salvation, I felt that I must write to you at once to encourage you to fight in defence of the faith that has once for all been entrusted to the keeping of Christ’s people.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:4] For there have crept in among you certain godless people, whose sentence has long since been pronounced, and who make the mercy of God an excuse for profligacy, and disown our only lord and master, Jesus Christ.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:5] Now I want to remind you — but you already know it all — that, though the Lord delivered the people from Egypt, yet he afterwards destroyed those who refused to believe in him;
[OEBcw - Jude 1:6] and that even those angels, who did not keep to their appointed spheres, but left their proper homes, have been kept by him for the judgment of the great day in everlasting chains and black darkness.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:7] Like Sodom and Gomorrah and the towns near them, which gave themselves up to fornication, and fell into unnatural vice, these angels now stand out as a warning, undergoing, as they are, punishment in eternal fire.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:8] Yet in the ​same way these people, too, cherishing vain dreams, pollute our human nature, reject control, and malign the celestial beings.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:9] Yet even Michael, the archangel, when, in his dispute with the devil, he was arguing about the body of Moses, did not venture to charge him with maligning, but said merely ‘The Lord rebuke you!’
[OEBcw - Jude 1:10] But these people malign whatever they do not understand; while they use such things as they know by instinct (like the animals that have no reason) for their own corruption.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:11] Alas for them! They walk in the steps of Cain; led astray by Balaam’s love of gain, they plunge into sin, and meet their ruin through rebellion like ​Korah.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:12] These are the people who are blots on your ‘love-feasts,’ when they feast together and provide without scruple for themselves alone. They are clouds without rain, driven before the winds; they are leafless trees without a vestige of fruit, dead through and through, torn up by the roots;
[OEBcw - Jude 1:13] they are wild sea waves, foaming with their own shame; they are ‘wandering stars,’ for which the blackest darkness has been reserved for ever.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:14] To these people, as to others, Enoch, the seventh in descent from Adam, declared — ​‘See! The Lord has come with his hosts of holy ones around him,
[OEBcw - Jude 1:15] to execute judgment on all people, and to convict all godless people of all their godless acts, which in their ungodliness they have committed, and of all the harsh words which they have spoken against him, godless sinners that they are!’
[OEBcw - Jude 1:16] These people are always murmuring, and complaining of their lot; they follow where their passions lead them; they have arrogant words on their lips; and they flatter others for the sake of what they can get from them.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:17] But you should, dear friends, recall what was foretold by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ;
[OEBcw - Jude 1:18] how they used to say to you — ​‘As time draws to an end, there will be scoffers, who will be led by their godless passions.’
[OEBcw - Jude 1:19] These are the people — animal and unspiritual — who cause divisions.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:20] But you must, dear friends, build up your characters on the foundation of your most holy faith, pray under the guidance of the Holy Spirit,
[OEBcw - Jude 1:21] and keep within the love of God, while waiting for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ, to bring you to eternal life.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:22] To some show pity, because they are in doubt. ‘Drag them out of the fire,’ and save them.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:23] To others show pity, but with caution, hating the ​clothing polluted by their touch.
[OEBcw - Jude 1:24] To him who is able to guard you from falling, and to bring you into his glorious presence, blameless and rejoicing —
[OEBcw - Jude 1:25] to the one God, our Saviour, be ascribed, through Jesus Christ, our Lord, glory, majesty, power, and dominion, as it was before time began, is now, and will be for all time to come. Amen.
[OEBcw - Rev 1 - start] 
[OEBcw - Rev 1:1] The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him to make known to his servants, concerning what must shortly take place, and which he sent and revealed by his angel to his servant John,
[OEBcw - Rev 1:2] who testified to the message of God and to the testimony to Jesus Christ, omitting nothing of what he had seen.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:3] Blessed is the one who reads, and blessed are they who listen to, the words of this prophecy, and lay to heart what is here written; for the time is near.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:4] From John, to the seven churches which are in Roman Asia. Blessing and peace be yours from him who is, and who was, and who will be, and from the seven spirits that are before his throne,
[OEBcw - Rev 1:5] and from Jesus Christ, ‘the faithful witness, the first-born from the dead, and the Ruler of all the kings of the earth.’ To him who loves us and freed us from our sins by his own blood —
[OEBcw - Rev 1:6] and he made us ‘a kingdom of priests in the service of God,’ his Father! ​— to Him be ascribed glory and dominion for ever. Amen.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:7] ‘He is coming among the clouds!’ Every eye will see him, even those who pierced him; ‘and all the nations of the earth will mourn over him.’ So will it be. Amen.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:8] ‘I am the Alpha and the Omega,’ says the Lord, the God who is, and who was, and who will be, the Almighty.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:9] I, John, who am your brother, and who share with you in the suffering and kingship and endurance of Jesus, found myself on the island called Patmos, for the sake of the message of God and the testimony to Jesus.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:10] I fell into a trance on the Lord’s day, and I heard behind me a loud voice, like the blast of a trumpet.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:11] It said — ‘Write what you see in a book and send it to the seven churches, to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamus, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicaea.’
[OEBcw - Rev 1:12] I turned to see what voice it was that spoke to me; and when I turned, I saw seven golden lamps,
[OEBcw - Rev 1:13] and in the midst of the lamps one ‘like a man, in a robe reaching to his feet,’ and with a golden girdle across his breast.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:14] ‘The hair of his head was as white as wool, as white as snow; his eyes were like flaming fire;
[OEBcw - Rev 1:15] and his feet were like brass’ as when molten in a furnace; ‘his voice was like the sound of many streams,’
[OEBcw - Rev 1:16] in his right hand he held seven stars, from his mouth came a sharp two-edged sword, and his face was like ‘the sun in the fulness of its power.’
[OEBcw - Rev 1:17] And, when I saw him, I fell at his feet like one dead. He laid his hand on me and said — ‘Do not be afraid. I am the First and the Last,
[OEBcw - Rev 1:18] ​the Everliving. I died, and I am alive for ever and ever. And I hold the keys of the Grave and of the place of the dead.
[OEBcw - Rev 1:19] ​Therefore write of what you have seen and of what is happening now and of what is about to take place —
[OEBcw - Rev 1:20] ​the mystic meaning of the seven stars which you saw in my right hand, and the seven golden lamps. The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches, and the seven lamps are the seven churches.
[OEBcw - Rev 2 - start] 
[OEBcw - Rev 2:1] ​To the angel of the church in Ephesus write: — “These are the words of him who holds the seven stars in his right hand, and walks among the seven golden lamps: —
[OEBcw - Rev 2:2] ​I know your life, your toil and endurance, and I know that you cannot tolerate evil-doers. I know, too, how you tested those who declare that they are apostles, though they are not, and how you proved them false.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:3] ​You possess endurance, and have borne much for my name, and have never grown weary.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:4] ​But this I have against you — You have abandoned your first love.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:5] ​Therefore remember from what you have fallen, and repent, and live the life that you lived before; or else, I will come and remove your Lamp from its place, unless you repent.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:6] ​But this is in your favour — You hate the life lived by the Nikolaitans, and I also hate it.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:7] ​Let him who has ears hear what the Spirit is saying to the churches. To him who conquers — ​to him I will give the right ‘to eat the fruit of the Tree of life, which stands in the Paradise of God.’ “
[OEBcw - Rev 2:8] To the angel of the church in Smyrna write: — “These are the words of him who is the First and the Last, who died, but is restored to life: —
[OEBcw - Rev 2:9] ​I know your persecution and your poverty — yet you are rich! I know, too, the slander that comes from those who declare that they are God's people, though they are not, but are a Congregation of Satan.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:10] ​Do not be afraid of what you are about to suffer. The devil is about to throw some of you into prison so that you may be tempted, and may undergo persecution for ten days. Be faithful even to death, and I will give you the Crown of life.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:11] ​Let those who have ears hear what the Spirit is saying to the churches. Those who conquer will suffer no hurt from the Second Death.”
[OEBcw - Rev 2:12] To the angel of the church in Pergamus write: — “These are the words of him who holds the sharp two-edged sword: —
[OEBcw - Rev 2:13] ​I know where you live, where the throne of Satan stands. And yet you hold to my name, and you did not disown my faith even in the days of Antipas, my faithful witness, who was put to death among you where Satan dwells.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:14] ​Yet I have a few things against you — You have among you those who hold to the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to put temptations in the way of the Israelites, so that they should eat idol-offerings and commit licentious acts.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:15] ​Again you have among you those who hold in the same way to the teaching of the Nikolaitans.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:16] ​Therefore repent, or else, I will come quickly and contend with such people with words that will cut like a sword.
[OEBcw - Rev 2:17] ​Let those who have ears hear what the Spirit is saying to the churches.
